text: I've been here a few times this summer.  Each meal has been excellent. Innovative and interesting menue that constantly changes. Friendly service but not the best, a little slow.
I have stopped by for diner a couple of times here at this restaurant. The food is great, kid friendly and great service!
Terrible service, order incorrect, very rude waitress. I wouldn't come here again. I asked to change something to my order and she said they're too busy to make adjustments...

Recently had a horrible experience here. First off, it was way over priced. Our food was ok, but the quality nor quantity did not meet expectations. We paid $10 for maybe 12 cheese curds around the size of a quarter. There was fruit flies in our water glasses, and all over the restaurant in general. When we asked for additional condiments, we were given remarkably small proportions and were charged without being notified. The server brought my sister a salad without dressing so she then asked for oil and vinegar, but the server only returned with an empty olive oil container. Highly disappointed with the food, environment, and service at this restaurant and will not return.

I've been here numerous times throughout the years and I can't figure out why it's always so busy?!  I have thought in the past that the food was bland and lacked flavor.  I decided I'd try it again to give it another chance... and ordered a turkey sandwich. Um... deli turkey - and not good deli turkey (I am not a deli meat snob), but this seemed to resemble the prepackaged turkey that's shaped into a scalloped round. It was flavorless... redeeming the sandwich was guacamole and sweet potato fries... I would have done better with the grocery store for turkey.  I tried a bite of the tuna melt which was not bad, but honestly, not impressed with the turkey...  Service was friendly and efficient. I may return, but would stick to the hot items as I'm guessing they take more time with those (as evidenced by tuna melt).

My wife and I have dined here on several occasions. We've been very happy with every meal so far. The service and food has been good. My only complaint is that I would like the menu to feature more vegetarian and fish options. There are a few really good options, such as the veggie burger, crab & shrimp roll, and fish tacos. But the menu could use a few more veggie/fish options. I really love their outdoor seating arrangement. I would definitely recommend this place.

I stopped here for a late lunch with a friend and loved it. I sat on the patio and the staff was wonderful and the food and drinks were amazing. Great quiet atmosphere. A place I will come back too in order to try other items on the menu.

My fiancé and I got dinner here last night and enjoyed their $5 burger and fries, Tuesday night special. It was terrific! We were having a stressful day and our server Chelsea was awesome! We ordered the Shrimp Cobb salad to share, which was delicious BTW, and she split it into two dishes, which was a substantial amount. I asked for honey mustard for my burger and fries. Chelsea said they didn't have any, BUT the chef made me some and it was very yummy! We enjoyed our dinner. Water was refilled a plenty and for a $5 burger, it was very good! We'll definitely make it a spot we frequent often in the future.

I moved a few blocks away from here about a month ago and I think this will be my new weekend brunch spot! Came here on a Saturday morning and the staff was extremely friendly! The food came out quickly and the waitress was quick to refill my coffee. We ordered the doughnuts and two entrees and everything was cooked to perfection! They also have a Mexican section of their brunch menu which looks enticing for the next time. There is also a beautiful patio to sit on during the summer. Nothing crazy or fancy but a good quality overall brunch.  Bacon - 5 stars Eggs - 3 stars (a little bit runny) Potatoes - 5 stars Coffee - 5 stars Doughnuts - 4 stars Service - 5 stars

Just no! I don't know if I ordered the wrong thing, but I ordered the fish tacos with beans and rice. It just was not good all the way around. The tacos were just blah, with the beans and rice totally bland with no flavor. There were 3 tacos on the plate, with a mound of rice, and beans poured over the rice. The presentation alone had left me standoffish, but I forged ahead, soon wishing I would have ordered something else within two bites into the dish.  Service was ok, my drink got refilled, but nothing special. I probably would not be back.
Good patio and good food.  Always a solid choice.  We enjoy sitting outside on their patio in the summer.  I recommend the Roscoe burger.

A nice quaint corner restaurant in the heart of Roscoe Village.  John's was packed inside and out on a Sunday at 2/230pm.  We were seated promptly.  The menu is small, page one more sugary/breakfast food such as pancakes & donuts, with page 2 being for the burgers.  My boyfriend ordered the Cowboy burger and I built my own traditional burger. The burgers come with Lettuce, tomato, and pickles.  I asked for no tomato.  I saw no option for raw onion, but asked if they could give me that in lieu of sauteed, which they were accomadating.  American cheese and bacon to finish it off, with a doneness of medium rare. My burger came out with just the raw onion I asked for, and was missing the lettuce and pickles.  It took a while for the waitress to bring back the missing vegetables, so my burger sat there uneaten.  When I ate the burger, it was a dry medium rare, which is a sign that when they pressed the patties, they did so too hard. My boyfriend's burger was messy with a lot of the Merkt's pub cheddar, onion jam, and chipotle sauce.  He wound up scraping his pattie off with excess toppings. All in all, John's Place is average, and nothing special.  I'm not saying boo to it, but I wouldn't consider this a must stop with all the other restaurants on this strip.

LIE* CHEAT* AND STEAL. I went there for lunch today. I asked about the specials, the woman with short hair told me it was SALMON. I then asked about the $5 burger/fries special...she seemed to forget(even though posted 5 times on the front window). I decided to go with the burger and fries. I even asked if fries were included, she said no and charged me $3. I also ordered a malbec and sent it back since it was rancid. I switched to pinot which tasted fine, however since she was irritated with me, she gave me less than a half glass.  The whole experience sucked. The burger was less than respectful. I paid the bill, tipped $4 and asked the busboy about the special. He said he told the waitress she was wrong, but this waitress still left the $3 on the bill. I decided to not request the $3 back. Clearly this woman was that desperate for $3. I will never return
For brunch we had granola and homemade donuts.AMAZING!    Like from another world amazing  Service too
This place has very friendly staff! The food is not bad either! The Cheese Curds are delicious!

Great food, great service and wonderful atmosphere! We met the owner, John, nice guy. Make a point of visiting this place whenever you're looking for a breakfast place in Chicago. I wish John would open a restaurant in Old Town Pasadena.

This morning we ordered French toast, Kids Corndogs, and Blueberry pancakes; the simplest breakfast  - We ended up waiting on our food for a good 30 minutes without any attention from staff.  This NOT acceptable when people who arrived later than us received their food in less than 10 min  Also, it would be nice to offer to set up the umbrella for our table.... not putting it up right after we left .... Due to the long wait, we had to change to an indoor table because we could not sit in the direct sun while waiting for our delayed order.  ....

We live in Roscoe and have probably eaten here 30 times and food is always consistently good, which says something. Kid friendly as well, which is sort of a must in this neighborhood now. Al fresco is a lot of fun there, and you can sit and have a beer outside while waiting for your carry out order. Some of our favorite items include the cowboy burger, torta de pollo, chopped shrimp salad.
obviously this place has changed. slow kitchen. disorganized service. less than ordinary food. move on.

John's Place..... just what we have been looking for! A cozy neighborhood joint with great food and outstanding service. John was there making sure that his guests were happy and boy were we!  The donuts.... cooked to order were silly good! The Chilaquiles..... just get em!!
Great place to bring kids, and the food is good as well. Good burgers and brunch, great kids meals also
Great spot for locals. The food and service is always good, but there is nothing memorable about John's Place.

This place is the best. My husband and I have been coming here for two years since we live down the street and it's such a great neighborhood atmosphere. The owner walks around and talks to everyone if he's in, the wait staff is always kind and efficient, and the food is phenomenal. The Mexican food specifically is my favorite. It is not stuffy, and definitely a feel good casual restaurant. Family friendly and date night friendly. Brunch is great too. We always always leave happy and stuffed.
Atmosphere is great. Food's alright. Service is alright. But the prices are just too high.

John's Place is Now one of my favorites brunch places in the city.. We got to John's place and everything was good Service was excellent, super friendly and let me tell you they were very efficient, we were a party of five and we ordered in pairs, so when the food came out our server took the initiative to split one meal into two plates since I was going to be sharing with my sister. We ordered the French toast and the Chicken Hash dishes and they were amazing!  One of my friends ordered the glaze donuts and they were tiny, the perfect size so you don't feel guilty for eating them. The taste, pretty delicious! I also ordered the Yellow smoothie and it was cold and refreshing. I can't just wait to go back!!  Amazing service!! Thank you!

Best quinoa bean burger!  I am not a vegetarian, but love veggie burgers and always in the search of a good one.  This is a "home made" type, not Boca Burger, spicy and delicious.  You can have other items added on to the burger.  The sweet potatoe fries are great,too!  They are not the packaged kind.  The service was a bit slow, 1:00 in the afternoon on Sat., but was busy.  The place was full of f "high chairs" that you had to navigate around to get in, but they were great enough to sit the kids up front and the people without in the back.  I would like to try the brunch, but will come back for the "burger".
Last night, I ordered the Salmon Oscar - it was awesome.  Served hot.  Fresh cut carrots and broccoli.  Big portion of salmon and rice with a great sauce.  Terrific.

Honestly I have no complaints whatsoever for this place! We recently moved to the neighborhood and it's our go to spot when we can't decide on new places. Absolutely love the Roscoe burger which I get nearly every time but I've also tried the cheese curds, southwest salad, and tacos all being great. I've also had the margs which are great. Wait staff has always been super friendly. Had someone in training last time we went and looks like hell bra great asset to the team.
Excellent service with very good food.  We really enjoyed lamb flatbread and spicy capellini with shrimp.  Empanadas were delicious but a bit heavy.  Burger was just OK.  I'd return.

Even though it was the lunch rush, our server was very calm and always there when we needed her. She was very kind and answered all of our questions.  Our food was fantastic! I had the turkey sandwich expecting something plain and now I can't get my mind of the sauce they used. 10/10 would come again!

Really solid place for typical American dinner cuisine or Mexican inspired brunch in Roscoe Village. Went to John's Place most recently for brunch on a Saturday morning around 9:30. The patio was full but there were plenty of seats inside. Our waitress was very friendly and did a good job taking care of us. The breakfast burrito (with chorizo of course) sounded delicious so that's what I ended up getting. Really good! Good portion size + breakfast potatoes for a good price. My friend's pancakes also looked and tasted good. I left John's full, satisfied and without spending mucho dinero. I've also had some really good burgers here in the past as well. The food won't blow you away necessarily, but it's a hell of a lot nicer than making it yourself! Good work, John.

I do not recommend this restaurant, the service is awful!! We got there excited about the food in this place but we couldn't even try it. We had to wait more than five minutes to get any kind of service, the waiter came and instead of giving us at least water (what Is usual) he told us that we needed to wait for the water ?? !! Ha? So we wait and wait and wait.... After more than ten minutes no water!  There was a guy who I guess is the manager, he saw us waiting and waiting and he didn't do anything.  After several minutes we got .. !the water!! And then no one showed in our table to take our order, we wait and wait and wait and nothing!  But we had a good view of people returning their food, well that's a sign too so we decided to just leave after several minutes waiting for nothing.  Please do not go to that restaurant.

Best brunch place in Roscoe Village! My husband, sister, and I visited on a Saturday morning and were served right away. Each of our meals were delicious, and the atmosphere was great! We can't wait to go back!

Good food.  Good service.  Good prices and very relaxed atmosphere, welcome to family and pets.  We were visiting from Massachusetts and sat outside on a perfect early evening.  Tilapia bowl was tasty and Fish Tacos were very good.    It attracts a lot of families but John says that it better for singles after 7:30PM.  He came by to see how we were doing and they tell me he's there all the time.  Very friendly and therefore so is restaurant.

First off food was great. Service, not so great, it sucked. Will I be back, probably. Details are below. -Food was fresh, hot and quick.  Wife had the southwest chicken salad.  She raved that it was light and fresh. I had the chilaquiles.  It was delish. If only I was hungry, I would have finished it.  The tortillas, eggs and cheese were such a nice combination.  I've had other chilaquiles and it was either soggy or lack flavor and texture.  The house made guac was delicious.  The little had mac and cheese. He loved it.   -The iced tea is deliciously refreshing.   -Service was well, in a nutshell inattentive and pretentious.    They were busy, but still, it wasn't acceptableWalked to the counter to get seated/placed on a wait list.  There was no one at the counter.  However, there were a handful of people magically behind me in the same situation. When the food arrived, I had asked for an extra napkin.  Waitstaff didn't come back with a napkin until I was done with my meal.  Asked for a to go box, it never came. Had to flag another member of waitstaff.  I think these are simply requests, and not over demanding.  Didn't appreciate being overlooked/forgotten.   YMMV here in terms of service.
The food was GREAT! Homemade mac n cheese, fish tacos and Moscow mules. The atmosphere was really nice a quaint and very kid friendly too.

I've been to this place 4 or 5 times in the past month working construction in the area. I've always got the Roscoe burger as the pretty girl working recommended on my first visit and I haven't looked back. It comes with fries, but I've always got the sweet potato fries for $1 extra. $14 for a burger and fries- but it's probably the best cheeseburger I've had in my life.  My work mates like this place and their burgers as well. Always took our order to go, but they have limited nice seating and a small stocked bar.  My only beef is they always seem stingy on their ketchup packs, haha. 2 guys get 2 burgers and two fries and they put 3 ketchup packets in the bag. Annoying having to ask for more every time, but I'll put up with it for the awesome cheeseburgers.

Midweek lunch with a few kids and another adult plus myself.  Service was a bit slow considering that we had little ones with us.  The food was very good. The menu had a great variety of healthy options with some comfort food too.  I got the southwest chicken salad and it was perfect. The chicken was incredibly tasty and all the toppings complimented each other well.  I'll be back to johns place for sure to try all the other tasty things I saw on the menu!

John's Place is a staple for Roscoe Village and has quickly become a favorite of mine since moving to the neighborhood. I'm usually their for dinner but it's a good brunch/lunch place as well. So far I only ever get the Turkey Meatloaf because it's that good, but I have it on authority that the burgers are pretty good too. I've also had their taco specials before and those are pretty good but I recommend asking if you can get extra tortillas because the fillings tend to be so plentiful and sauce-heavy that they break the tortilla making for a messy experience. Service has always been good when I go so no complaints there. I definitely recommend going if you're looking for a place for a good meal either by yourself or with a date or with a couple friends or even your family. It's a place that caters to all.
Living in Roscoe Village, this is our go-to place. Consistently good food, consistently friendly staff, and family-friendly.

Good brunch spot. Portions are just the right size, high quality food. Also probably has the best bloody mix on Roscoe. It gets packed on the weekend, so get there early if you want to avoid the wait.

I have been coming to John's Place for years. If you are into healthy eating and enjoy vibrant flavors, you will love this place! Absolutely kid-friendly, John's Place has more of a family feel to it. The menu is ethnically diverse and they handle the different cuisine types with expertise. I was pleased to find them on Giftie. I hadn't been there in a couple of years and were they not on Giftie, I wouldn't have been reminded to start going back!
Love fish tacos !!! Found them trow giftie ! This place is great !! Love thier lamb too! Super fresh !!  love it !!

The food was fantastic! I had the chicken and lettuce wraps. It came with peanut sauce. The waitress was very friendly as well as the owner John. It is a great neighborhood place and I plan on visit again!

This "Place of John" or as the locals call it "John's Place" is truly a place of greatness.   In fact the word "jaansplace" was rumored to be word that the native Illiniwek tribe who first inhabited this region of the world to mean "place of edible deliciousness"   I jest of course, but the salads and flatbreads of this Roscoe Village neighborhood gem truly hit the spot.  Come for the salad and stay for brunch.

One of my favorite places in Roscoe Village. Always delicious food and friendly service (Paul is the best!). Love the weekend brunch options and Bloody Mary's. My favorite is the chilaquiles with pulled pork and guacamole; also the pumpkin pie pancakes. They have great salads, burgers, and rice bowls at lunch/dinner. Cute patio in the summer and cozy dining room year round.

This is my favorite brunch place in Roscoe, maybe even in Chicago. The prices are reasonable, the service is always excellent, as is the food. I always get the Huevos Rancheros, and It is consistently great. I bring all my friends here when they come in from out of town, and they all have enjoyed it. Outdoor seating during the summer is awesome!

Roscoe Village village has plenty of options for a nice weekend brunch, but John's Place with one of my favorites when I lived in the neighborhood.  The service is always friendly, and the food was always good. Roscoe Village is a very family friendly area so there may be a lot of kids there when you visit. If lots of strollers don't bother you then John's place is a lovely place to have lunch. I would highly recommend the crab and shrimp roll!

Went to visit my friends who live in Roscoe village and they wanted to go to John's place. The restaurant looked really nice but a little small and narrow. The service was good and they had a decent alcohol selection. That night was tacos for $3, but I chose to order the John's Chopped salad and some sweet potato fries as others on Yelp have recommended. Overall a good meal and a pleasant experience.

I went with a friend on Thanksgiving Eve. Service was excellent and relatively quick. I had The Cowboy Burger medium rare. The sauce is what made the burger (bbq chipotle sauce). Fries were pretty good. The price is a little bit higher than I'd feel comfortable with, but overall experience was surely positive.
Loved the bread pudding French toast... Highly recommend for everyone to try it. Our server Paul was very friendly!
I enjoy Johns Place a lot. I get the black bean burger almost every time, but my husband always tries something new and its always great no matter what. Also very kid friendly.

It was a dark and stormy night (no really,  it was!) and I was killing time before meeting some friends so I stopped by this corner restaurant looking for some conversation and to get out of the rain.  Even though I didn't have any of the kitchen's faire, I can tell I want to come back to this place next week. The hostess and bar tender were two of the nicest, genuine people you will meet in hospitality, and certainly the most welcoming when you come out of the rain for some delicious comfort food.  I'll update next week when I get dinner, but they already have in 5 stars for being a safe harbor and a warm light in Roscoe Village.

I've been here several times and the food here is always good! They have a great kids menu, dinner/lunch/breakfast menu, and their drinks are always delicious. However based on my visits here your experience will seriously be based on which server you have. If you get the blonde girl that takes 15 minutes to bring water just get up and leave. If you get the brunette one who's a bit older (sorry forgot your name!) go ahead and stay. You can be confident you will get great recommendations and great service. Again, if you get the young-ish blonde lady she will ask you to hurry up and pay your bill (because eating lunch with your niece and sister for 30 minutes is just too long) because she has to make her rehearsal.. You understand.

Excellent food and the service was top-notch. We had the hummus - tasty and fresh as can be.  We also indulged with the chicken tacos - delicious is an understatement!  The tacos were sooooo good - authentic all the way.  The kiddo had the grilled cheese - he demolished it in mere minutes.  The service was just as great as the food.  I wished I lived closer so I could frequent the place more often!

One of my favorites in Roscoe Village. The Roscoe burger is top notch.  Extremely kid friendly, inside the diner and at the outside eating areas, even on the Roscoe Village scale of kid friendly spots.

John's is my neighborhood brunch spot. I've never been here on anything other than a Saturday or Sunday morning to sit outside with the pooch and a friend or two and watch the day go by. All my meals have been very substantial and very delicious.
Our waitress was excellent and prices are reasonable. My margarita tasted like orange juice only. Food seemed frozen/ pre cooked but there was a nice atmosphere.

Worst service I've ever had. I was by myself, getting a quick brunch. I Didn't get a drink for ten minutes. (All I wanted was coffee) I ordered my omelette, asked for no goat cheese. Goat cheese came on the omelette. I told my waitress and she told me I didn't request to take it off. I didn't eat any of it and she just brought me my bill. I put a $20 down and she didn't even bring me my change, I had to ask one of the bus boys to get my change for me.
Does the job but food is nothing special (I order the burger)...no complaints... Staff and owner are very friendly.

This place was cute and casual. We sat outside, and the service was really great. Our server was very nice and attentive. I thought the food was a bit over priced for what it was, we paid about $50 for two salads and one glass of wine a piece, and it was bar food at best. Not bad quality, just not worth 15$ a pop. However, it's still a great casual place to eat with nice service and a cute patio. Haven't tried brunch yet but heard that's great !

I am so glad my mom and I went for dinner last night. She and I have always enjoyed they're brunch on weekends. But ever since my husband and I moved here a couple years ago, dinners had been hit or miss.  The menu is different and they no longer have the hostess I complained about a couple years ago. Both servers are very nice that we have had. We always have our fave guy when we come for brunch...I'll get his name next time.  Ok, onto the food: everything we have had for brunch, whether sweet or savory, has been delicious.  They had Elvis pancakes once on special and they were amazing.  For dinner last night we had Thai chicken soup, my mom and I both loved it. We also got burgers, which were very tasty. Mine was overlooked and my mom's was perfect.  (We both ordered medium). But I prefer over to under so I was fine. Fries were good too.  I love that we were able to sit outside and have our dinner before it got too chilly. I'm excited to put John's on my brunch AND dinner list now.

Love this place.  We come here all the time.  Everything I have ordered has been good. The menu is straight forward and the food is very consistent.  The ingredients are always fresh and the service is always friendly and quick.  AND.... it is very kid friendly.  Con: they close between dinner and lunch - We eat dinner early and always forget.

John's is still pretty good food however I think it's incredibly overpriced for what you get.  For example, the Roscoe omelette, which is spinach, tomato, green onion and mushrooms with a goat cheese fondue across the top is $11. If you want this made with only egg whites it's $13.  This comes with a small serving of potatoes and toast. This is in line with pricing at restaurants on the Mag mile or Bib Gourmand appointed establishments and because it's up in a quiet neighborhood it doesn't warrant these price points.

We've only gone here for brunch, but we really like it. Generally not too long a waitlist and its a good place to bring kids. Food is really good and they are very efficient about getting to food out. Nice tables outside for summer time. I find the inside a little on the small side. They do have booths but they aren't always the most practical with small children.

Finally got a chance to try John's Place after moving to the neighborhood over 2 years ago.  We were greeted warmly by the hostess and seated promptly in one of the big booths in the back.  Hubby and I split a Southwest Salad and a Roscoe Burger, which was more than enough for the two of us.  The salad had a great kick with the spice grilled chicken.  I loved the pimento, bacon cheese, and onion rings on the burger, but the jalepeno marmalade was a little too spicy for me.  The burger itself had a nice charred taste to it.  For dessert, we split the salted caramel gelato, which was amazing!  I also wanted to try the Blondie Bar, but didn't have room :( Great neighborhood joint that is definitely kid friendly (there were a stack of high chairs stored in the back) and fits right in Roscoe Village.

(Brunch) Not that impressed.  The menu appears "farm fresh" with good ingredients, but the taste was pretty bland.  Pricing is a little high, for what you get. Service wasn't that good either.  The waitress forgot our bacon and brought it out after we already asked for the check.  Unfortunately, there wasn't an excuse because the place only had a few customers..that should have been the first sign.  I'd go somewhere else if you're looking for a more than ordinary brunch.

YAWN..... bland as hell. My stomach was in a huge knot and it ached after I ate the breakfast burrito. Carry a bottle of hot sauce if you plan to go in and dine on dry, bland kibble. What is the big deal about this place? The staff was nice, though.

Friday night city excursion... Our waiter deserves a trophy after serving my grouchy hungry kids and two parents who were at their wits end just wanting to get them fed. We fought hard and were determined to stop at a cool city restaurant in our old hood, when the truth is my kids were obsessed with getting a calzone from Pockets. Okay... no. Not never, just not tonight. I remembered John's Place on Webster being super family-friendly, and so I was hoping the vibe would be the same here. I figured as much, being in Roscoe Village and all, but I called ahead to see if they had a kids menu. Yep! Score!  We made the stop in, two tired hungry kids who were ready to kill each other at this point, and thankfully we found an open table. It was refreshing to walk past other families dining. We grabbed the kids menu and got to ordering right away. I was impressed with the options (see menu picture), but it's hard with growing eight-year old boys who require basically adult-sized portions, but not quite. Once the half-cup of water came out for them, we knew we were in trouble and decided to order a bunch of things off the kids menu for variety. Our waiter was super helpful to guide us with the perfect sides that they could split and mix up to make their experience fun. We ordered sliders for each of them and then a side of fries and mac n' cheese. Perfect! Of course we had to be careful to separate everything equally and not mix any spit (their request), but we managed with the request of an extra plate. I must say, the mac n' cheese rocks! It's well-seasoned and super gourmet.  We ordered fried cheese curds for the table, and I want one right now as I'm writing this! Lightly fried in a batter mixed with onions to make the flavor supreme. I ordered a turkey burger with fresh greens, Merkt's cheddar, mushrooms and avocado. Sadly, the burger wasn't for my taste buds. Just too rich and garlicky, but I tried. Hubby got the veggie wrap, and it was a ginormous portion with hummus and all sorts of veggies inside. John's Place was the first place I had ever tried a sweet potato fry in my life (many years ago), so of course I ordered those up as my side. Still soft and basic so you can really taste the potato.  Overall, our experience was lovely. But it was time to go after my son took my lemon and put it in his mouth like a boxer's mouth guard and pretended to start boxing. I don't have obnoxious kids, I really don't, but at this point we were just done. Still love you John's Place. We will be back!

Crab and Shrimp Roll. That's all I need to say. Better than any lobster roll I have ever had. Big chunks of crab and fresh quality tender shrimp in a tasty but not overpowering dressing on a perfect, buttered toasted roll. I want one right now! Amazing slaw as well and great pickles (asked for more and were happy to oblige). Lovely to sit outside and great, friendly service. Had a great time with the best food item in recent memory!
Awesome place!! Great customer service, great food, family friendly. I would tell all of my friends and family visiting from out of state .

After an evening of beer drinking and jousting at the Oyster Fest, I wandered into John's Place with some friends since they were one of the last locations that had oysters left. The place was packed as well as the outdoor seating areas, but it was a great atmosphere.  I had a great waitress who quickly ushered us out an order of a half dozen oysters and she even tolerated my annoying Brother, whose jokes can be funny but slightly offensive/creepish! I didnt like that they didnt have melted butter for the oysters, but, oh well! I love them though because I actually ended up leaving my tablet here by mistake (well, my Brother did) and John actually took it and kept it for us! I was terrified initially since I had no idea where we couldve put it down at or who couldve picked it up! Needless to say, it is safe and sound back in my possession. I just saw that they have Saturday and Sunday brunch as well; Ill be checking that out soon!

I really want to love this place. However, it's not my favorite in the neighborhood. I think John's has a lot of potential however the atmospher, and food is lacking. I will give major kudos for the chili, it has to be the best in the city and I'll give it three stars for it.

I've come here several times for breakfast on the weekends since moving to the neighborhood, and have always had great service and a great meal. But this morning I was really disappointed! I went this morning with a friend and we were promptly seated. Oyster Fest was today, and the restaurant was slow in terms of customers, but the staff seems busy in preparation for it. We quickly placed our order with our server, and then we didn't see her again for the next 25 to 30 minutes. After we realized how long we had waited for our food, we flagged down a manager, and he went to go check on our order. Our server came back, instead of the manager, and said that our ticket had been lost and the kitchen was working on it now. We weren't very happy and decided to walk over to Kitsch'n instead. Having been a server before, I feel like our server should have known that our ticket has been lost well before we inquired about our meal, because she should have been wondering what was taking so long as well. Seems like our server forgot about us!

Loved.  Get out there before summer ends to enjoy the outdoor deck. Then order a $5 beer on  tap and get the guac with chips to start. Get the cowboy burger, shrimp & crab roll, lamb frat bread with taziki sauce, or cowboy burger. All very good. Pick from a choice of reg or sweet potato fries. Very good.  Would come here again. We all loved our food, drinks, service, and atmosphere here here.

My boyfriend and I were looking for a good place to have a burger a couple weeks ago on a Monday evening around 4:30pm. When we were seated, there was one other couple seated towards the front with their toddler. We ordered our drinks and placed a food order for A Cowboy burger with chips, and a Roscoe burger with sweet potato fries. Shortly after that, another coupe sits down at the booth next to us, and puts a food order for 2 burgers in right away.  The server gets another table seated up front, and a food runner brings our order out- to the couple in the booth next to us. Our server goes to check on how their food is, and they inform him that it isn't what they ordered. The server looks slightly panicked and then looks at us (and yes we can clearly hear this exchange of events). He asks the couple if they had touched the plates, they say yes and they're sorry.....  He proceeds to pick up the plates and then set them down in front of us while promising that the other couple "NEVER touched the plates"..... I'm pregnant, and I was hungry enough to eat my own arm off, so we didn't say anything to our waiter about the mix up right then and there, but in retrospect, we should have. I used to wait tables, and understand that mistakes happen- but his bold face lie about the fact that the other couple had never touched the plates when we could clearly hear that they had was not only a sanitation issue, but completely unprofessional as well.  I would've rather waited for a plate that hadn't been touched on by others. The food was decent, but his plate was served to us with regular french fries instead of chips, and the burgers were both ordered medium, and cooked well. They were both so charred on the outside that it kind of interfered with tasting any of the other flavors on the food. We probably would give this place another shot, if it weren't for the complete lack of service. Left a bad taste in our mouths for sure.

Enjoyed my first time here . My friend had the Johns Scramble and really enjoyed it. French toast with cinnamon was also good, but the butter had a layer to it so the separation was just a bit unappetizing.  I think I had the cowboy and thought it was a good burger - not the best, but a good burger.  Overall, it met my expectations, and I did like the challah french toast. It didn't blow me away, but it was decent. A bit pricey for burgers and salad though in my opinion.

I am a fan of John's Place.  They serve a solid burger and a good brunch.  I have even done their taco night and thought that was pretty good.  The atmosphere is very relaxed and the artwork is cool.  The staff is terrific - they are always very pleasant and smiling which I imagine must be hard at times since the place is so kid friendly!  My kids love going here too.  If the fried cheese curds are on the menu they are a must try, as is the blondie sundae!

Food is great, service is excellent. Everyone has always been warm and kind (we love Ashley!!!) and it's a great place to bring kids if you don't feel like cooking but want something quick, cheap and tasty.  My only complaint is that every time we visit, the portion on the kids' mac & cheese shrinks yet the price remains the same.

Ate a late lunch here with some friends. We sat outside and was seated right away. I ordered challa French toast and Johns Scrambled.  The French Toast was delicious with just a hint of cinnamon. Although the butter wasn't as fresh.  The JS was very tasty. The potatoes were a bit dry but still good.  Service was fine. John the owner came by to say hello.  I will be back!

My girl and I were here for brunch yesterday.  We were excited to have their Shrimp and Grits, since I really liked them the last visit.  We both ordered the same thing, but we've err very disappointed.  I don't get it?  The shrimp were still good sized, but the quality was different, definitely a change for the worst.  The grits were lumpy and lacked flavor and the eggs had a strong vinegar taste, from being pouched.  There also was no sauce, but last time the sauce was really good?  It was a big disappointment from what I had eaten on the last visit.  Bummer!

my girlfriend susan and i had lunch here on saturday and sat al fresco since the weather was perfect. their john's chopped salad is really delicious and refreshing on a saturday afternoon brunch. susie had eggs on toast and french toast that she really liked. service was pretty good. i'd definitely go back if i'm ever in the roscoe village area.

I used to eat at the John's in Lincoln Park and always had a wonderful experience. Not so here. You're immediately presented with a sign that forbids you to enter with a drink, presumably coffee, from another establishment. So, they would prefer I go somewhere else? Rather than be pleased that I've chosen to eat here after picking up my favorite drink, they're just going to piss me off. So I ignored it, and the hostess was really rude about. Accept the fact that people like other coffee and welcome that. It's an offensive, off putting sign sign to read the minute you walk in. Talk about negative vibes. Then the next sign you said informs you that kids aren't allowed to run around. What are they going to complain about next? Our looks? Our clothes? You see where I'm going.
Outstanding brunch spot. Have been here many times and will continue to go back. Friendly staff, good seating, kid friendly, excellent menu. The omelets are outstanding.

I am a resident of Roscoe Village and have been to John's Place twice.  I have to say the customer service was outstanding.  The food was traditional breakfast food but what makes or breaks these places are the customer service.  It may be possible that the waiters were very attentive because the owner was in the restaurant but nonetheless it was a very pleasant experience.

Might be unfair to review a place based on 1 dish but the Drunken Chicken looked so good on the menu and was a definite miss. It was not very flavorful OR juicy. Needed to use hot sauce to flavor it up...never a good sign. I love goat cheese and love mashed potatoes, but the goat cheese mashed potatoes were also not too great. I might be back to try something else. Service was very good.
Above average burger! But more importantly the water was fresh, refilled often and well iced.

I've lived in the neighborhood for 3 years and prior to that, I was a big fan of the Lincoln Park location. However, methinks John is in a rut. The menu hasn't changed in over a year, and although I dig the kid-friendly atmosphere and love taco night, I think there's a huge opportunity here to mix things up and add some new and different menu items. Like a tuna melt. If the restaurant weren't right around the corner, we wouldn't go as often as we do.

Cute neighborhood spot! It was brunch-o'clock on a Sunday, and it was busy, but no wait! Definitely a lot of breeders - babies/toddlers galore, but it was still comfortable. I had a craving for a turkey burger, but didn't want to go to a pub this particular day and John's Place satisfied my craving! The turkey burger was juicy and well spiced. The sweet potato fries were really good too. My hubby got a regular burger and said it was really good, better than he expected. Only thing that could have made the burgers better - pretzel buns! The bread was okay but not pretzel bun good :) I would happily come back here for brunch or lunch. Nice relaxed atmosphere with a neighborhood feel. Delivers with good food and service too.

Moving Day to Roscoe Village! In a sea of boxes the only thing louder than my pops' grumbling at putting together a TV stand was the rumbling of my stomach. I Yelped the closest place with burgers and drinks so I could treat my helpers.  We took the quick two block walk to John's and sat right away. Service was friendly and attentive which I appreciated since I wanted to run back with hopes that someone finished unpacking for me. Side note: no one did A few of my helpers started out with a Spicy Bloody Mary. I am not a BM fan but it got they enjoyed it and looked pretty fun. I went with the Roscoe Burger based solely on the fact it had a jalapeno marmalade. The toppings were flavorful (marmalade, bacon-pimento cheese, and onion rings) and it was a decent size. I thought the meat lacked some flavor but maybe was overwhelmed by the toppings. Dad got the Cowboy Burger (which the waitress said is their best seller) which looked just as appetizing after a hard day's work. Others got salads, french toast, and then my one friend who just had another BM - all non-noteworthy stuff.  Overall my verdict is that I would come back for a quick bite and the food was tasty. I am happy to have it close but the prices don't match the quality. $12 for a burger either has to be Kobe or come with some awesome sides. Fries, chips, or coleslaw don't cut it.  But 3 stars isn't too shabby!

Stopped by for brunch and had a pleasant experience. My fiancé and I had plans originally to have brunch elsewhere but John's Place didn't have any wait which is nice for a Sunday and at the same token kind of odd. We shared a fried egg sandwich which was ok. The sandwich wasn't good or bad it was a regular sandwich nothing spectacular. We also shared the s'mores French toast and we're really happy with that. It was a huge portion so if you're gonna eat it alone you'll have left overs. The only thing I wasn't thrilled about was the service. Our waitress wasn't very attentive and my fiancé had to get up and actually hunt her down to ask for napkins.

This place is so gross, not sure why it has so many positive reviews. Service is fine and the atmosphere is nice ( very kid friendly). The food is just OK and overpriced. I understand it is convenient for those living in Roscoe Village, but every time my family and I eat here we regret it. Not worth a drive if you don't live down the street, and if you do live nearby i would advise walk ing a few blocks down and eating at Pizza Bella, Victory's Banner, or Kitsch'n instead.

A friend and I went to John's Place during Oysterfest ready to chow down on some oysters. We ordered a dozen and 2 glasses of Sangria. The Sangria was delicious, but the oysters were awful. They came stacked on top of eachother, at room temperature, and were super gritty. To top it off, more than one was green. We ate 8 (4 each) before uncovering the really horrible looking ones that were conveniently buried at the bottom. The waiter finally came by to give us a bill (this is the second time we saw him that afternoon). We showed him the remaining oysters which he called "natural" and he delivered the bill charging us in full for everything.  $50 for 2 small (but yummy) glasses of Sangria, 8 edible oysters, 4 "natural" oysters, and sub-par service.

Great service. Freindly and clean.  Presentation of the food was not awesome.  But what really got me was the price.  15 dollar fish tacos? 12 dollar salads with iceberg lettuce.  Thanks but no thanks.

Finally had an opportunity to try items on new weekend brunch menu -- although they introduced it a few months ago.  Breakfast sandwich is awesome!!! Might actually replace the breakfast burrito as my favorite.  Holy Grayle (sp?  I know they gave it some funky spelling) was a nice adult beverage to get me through a late Saturday morning.  I had to have two!!  I know everyone gripes about all the little kids at this place during certain times of the day.  Not John's fault -- parents should teach better manners and realize this is not their personal playground or day care.  The staff here is beyond professional and friendly -- they really add to the experience and another reason I keep coming back.  This is one of my all-time favorite casual spots in Chicago.  Keep up the quality, friendliness and great work!!

We've been going to John's since moving to the neighborhood about 5 years ago.  It was a solid, neighborhood go-to joint with great service and good food at a decent price.  But as the menu has changed we've noticed food quality and quantity steadily going down while prices rose drastically.  Average burger/sandwich is now $12-$14 which is pricey for a great burger, and just plain silly for a mediocre one. But one thing that always go to us...  At one point we were in there several times a week, sometimes twice in one day when I didn't feel like cooking!  The staff knew us by name, and John saw us there regularly.  Yet he never ONCE comped a single thing or so much as offered us a drink on the house.  Seriously?  I'm no expert but I would think a free drink every 5 years or so might be worth keeping some business :)   We go back maybe once a month now and all it does is remind of us why we don't go any more.  Doesn't seem so busy these days either.  Hopefully John will get the hint and make some changes.

This place is great; a couple girlfriends and I were in the neighborhood and decided to try John's. They have a decent beverage list and an excellent menu; it is a smaller menu, but very well thought out; all of the choices looked excellent. Unfortunately they were out of veg burgers, so my veg friends had to choose among the other items, which was not a problem.  Jonathan was our server and he seemed knowledgable about the beverage selection. He was quite friendly and attentive. I would like to go here again when I am in the area!

We were in town for my brother's bachelor party and stopped in here for brunch before heading out of town. As for the breakfast menu, they had some great options with creativity and your usual "eggs and bacon". I believe the concept is farm fresh food here. I am sure there is a difference but its probably more in your head. I can never tell in the taste department. The food was good- came out timely even with a new waitress and a large group. Portions are about right, not too much and just enough. Coffee was good- I am sure dirt water with caffeine in it would have been acceptable this day though.  Overall, solid food. Nothing too exceptional.

As a family, we have been going to John's Place on Roscoe since it opened, years ago.  It was a nice, family friendly place, with decent food.  I just came back from a dinner with my son and was very, very disappointing.  Prices have gone up considerably but the quality of food and service has gone down.   Here are couple of things that made the experience not so great: *The restaurant was full of smoke from the kitchen. *My $15 Baja Tacos were 3 Tacos and a cup of Instant Spanish Rice.  Taco's could have been good if the cabbage inside did not taste like soap. I still have a soapy aftertaste in my mouth.    Even my son commented that his food (plain pasta) tasted funny. Hope we don't get sick. *They usually offer bread basket with butter, but tonight somehow they forgot (although the restaurant was not full.) So for me, "So Long John's Place".  We will not be coming back anytime soon.

Another brunch place tested out and I give it four stars. After driving by this place countless times I figured it was about time to check it out. Overall I was really happy with the experience. The brunch menu is not as extensive as some other "brunch" places, but there were a nice variety of options that would please most palates. My friend and I got the Mexican hash, which was tasty. Two eggs, chicken, diced potatoes, chihuahua cheese and some other spices (I think). It was filling without making me feel like I could blow up. Always appreciated. Given that I have a ton of places to check off my brunch places list I probably won't be back soon, but if you're looking for a decent place, without a super long wait, that has ample outdoor seating, this is a good option.

A serious stable. Chop salad was amazing, so was the shrimp and quinoa salad, and soups. Seriously, what isn't good here? The burger was solid. It's nothing too fancy, just good food and comfortable and tasty interior.

If you like tuna tartare, then you're not an idiot, and you have to try the Tuna Poke. All their burgers are legit.  The John's Chopped Salad with the Tahini-sesame dressing is unreal. AND are server made a great Moscow Mule. Good food. Good service.

Fair at best. John's Place offers cheapo specials here during the week- like $3 tacos. At $3 they're a bargain at 1/2 the price. Where's the protein?  Nothing tastes homemade here. More like it's off the Sysco food service truck. The do have a dent veggie burger. But if I want a veggie burger, I'll go down the street to Victory's Banner.  I've wound up here when the wait at Piazza Bella is too long. I've always regretted eating here.
Great restaurant with very friendly staff.  Very friendly to kids in the restaurant as well.  The turkey buger is one of the best in the city.

I went to John's Place for lunch.  I am a vegetarian and also far too nice when it comes to restaurant etiquette.  I ordered the marinated tofu sandwich which sounded great and appealing from the description on the menu.  I nearly burst out into laughter when it was presented to me.   It looked like the they took the entire block of tofu you get at the store and just set it on top of a griller.... Lightly toasted both pieces of bread.... Added some soggy and flavor-less sautéed spinach (that I asked for), cucumber, tomato and some lettuce.  Never got the sprouts that were described on the menu  and it did not come on tomato foccacia... It came on a regular piece of wheat toast.  By the time it reached my table the bottom half of my sandwich was drenched and soggy and not edible..... I was so hungry and did not have the heart to tell my waiter that this looks absolutely atrocious... so I opened up one side of the bread and started cutting the tofu into pieces, drenching the taste with ketchup and fries....  Being a vegetarian I knew that the tofu was absolutely not marinated in anything...It was the ugliest sandwich I have ever seen in my life.  This is NOT TO DISRESPECT John's Place... because they are great establishment... BUT PLEASE PULL THAT SANDWICH OFF YOUR MENU!  I STILL HAVE A STOMACH ACHE FROM IT ... AND IT IS NEARLY DINNER TIME.  The combination was just awful I have to admit it was the worst lunch I have experienced in a long time.   Please... please... please... remake that sandwich.. make it into a wrap... do not use wheat bread and a WHOLE BLOCK of tofu... add the ingredients that are on the menu.. and just never ever serve it the way you did today. It was so awful. I am sorry!  I will stick to brunch or just appetizer+beer when I come again.  Thank you.

We always try the eggs benedict on a first visit to a new place to gauge its merit - it was excellent, we will return. Also recommend the chicken/apple/Gouda sausage and perfectly cooked and seasoned potatoes. Staff was very attentive and friendly, at least 4 people helped ensure we were happy, hydrated and table stayed neat.  The Chicago art caught our eye and now adorns our home...we bought two pieces by local artist Tim Jarosz. We will return regularly.

I usually do take out here because I do not work to far. The order was done very quickly and accomodated all my coworkers.  I had ordered a cuban which by far was average.  There was nothing exciting about it and the taste was pretty bland.  My coworkers ordered salad which they stated was average as well.

John's Place on Roscoe has become a new go-to place for weekend brunch / lunch. When I wake up in the morning I oftentimes find myself craving a breakfast burrito from here... they are so so good! Just a tad bit spicy, not greasy or too eggy. Paired with a side of a single pumpkin pie pancake and I'm very happy. This pancake is one of the best pancakes I have ever had - tastes just like pumpkin pie and the maple butter and syrup topping just puts it over the top. I would highly recommend the burgers as well - the turkey burger and black jack especially.  For a laid back neighborhood spot with reliably good brunch / lunch food and no wait for a table, this is the place to go in Roscoe Village.

Good neighborhood spot. I go there for lunch a few times a month. I've had the burgers, chop salads, sweet potato fries and soups. All good.  Service has been very friendly and efficient.  Lots of seating outdoors when weather permits.

My boyfriend and I recently enjoyed a late Sunday afternoon lunch here, long after any sort of Sunday brunch rush they might have had. Overall, we like our lunches (and our cocktails) and we'll definitely be back, hopefully for dinner. Service was wonderful. Attentive, informative, laidback, but never overbearing.  A couple of tips for improvement: While my veggie burger and my boyfriend's omelette were delicious, the fries were extremely lackluster. Maybe that's Karma's way of telling me I should lay off the papas fritas, but I was disappointed in the fries, especially because everything else was such good upscale pub grub. Lastly, the ketchup and mustard bottles were, to put it delicately, a bit gross-looking. There was excessive dried condiment caked around the bottle openings, and they could have used a nice cleaning before making their way to our table. But really, the food and service were great, and if you're looking for some nice pub food in Roscoe Village, I'd recommend John's Place.

with a menu that is fairly unimaginative and a restaurant laden with children, i didn't expect to like this place so much. it is very, very homey.  like i mentioned, many families, but many well behaved families. the menu is comforting & provides options and best of all, the food is good.  they were, unfortunately, out of the arancini [which i am lead to believe that if they are out of at 6pm must be frozen.. :o(], so we opted for the grilled cheese sticks instead.  while the grilled cheese was nothing to write home about, it was perfectly grilled and paired with a DELICIOUS creamy tomato soup.   i had the vegetarian burger which was, though a little dry, very tasty.  served with a side salad and delicious sesame dressing, i was left super full, and with not much out from my checkbook. they had half-priced bottles of wine on the night we went which helped us forget about the sheer number of children and reminded me that when i do become a mother, I will still have the option of guzzling plenty of wine, like all the other families around us..

John's Place has good drinks- interesting cocktails and mixed well.  My husband and I had the Dark and Stormy, a rum and ginger ale drink which was really good. These were the best part of our meal.  We split a house salad with their dijon vinegrette for an appetizer.  The salad was fresh, but served in a really hot bowl making the lettuce warm.  The vinegrette was too vinegary and tart to be considered good.  For dinner, my hubby had the skirt steak, which was pretty good but didn't blow his socks off.  The meat was seasoned pretty well and grilled nicely, but the rice was a little bland and the grilled pepper rings on the side were standard.  I had the Greek Burger, which was lamb.  I thought the burger had good taste, but the feta, cucumber, onion, tomato 'salsa' and tzatziki sauce were so wet and runny that the bottom bun became so soggy I couldn't eat the burger with my hands.  Ended up ditching he bun completely and just eating the lamb patty with a knife and fork.  The fries were cold and looked like they had been on someone else's plate (there was random BBQ sauce on some of them).  John's Place isn't terrible, but definitely not good enough for a return visit.  There are so many other places in Rosco Village worth multiple visits.

I had a downright lovely lunch today at John's Place!  My colleague Andrea R suggested we meet here for a Roscoe Village lunch, and to her surprise...I've never been. To be quite honest, I've avoided it because its a baby/family magnet and when presented with the opportunity to try it we always opt for elsewhere.  However, midweek/midday lunch? Perfect Quiet, but still comfortably buzzing with lunchers. Our server and service was actually quite exceptional (hat tip to the red bearded fellow behind the bar). Very friendly, accommodating, sweet. Truly, maybe he was just happy we didn't have any messy toddlers with us? Regardless, it was a very pleasant meal and he was super helpful.  I had the John's Chopped Chicken wrap with sweet potato fries (oh yes, get the sweet potato fries!). The goat cheese was the perfect complement (and all of their cheeses are pasteurized, in case you are eating for two...as Andrea is!) and it was just the right balance between filling and light. Get those sweet potato fries. Get 'em! I really enjoyed my lunch.  A really lovely place to lunch. It's a madhouse on the weekends, but this is prime for a relaxed lunch or brunch during the week. Super approved!  *Full bar available.  *Diet Coke is quite suitable with free refills!  *Crowded on the weekends.

If you are looking for a nice relaxed atmosphere for some breakfast or lunch, then I would recommend you stop in at Johns Place.  They have good prices and nice portions.   Also, in the nicer weather, they have an outside seating area.  Great place to hang outside with your doggie !!!
Had a great dinner with some friends, walked in on a Friday evening waited a little while at the bar and quickly received drinks, we were sat within 10 min and then the service and food were great.

Went there last night on a whim and left really impressed. The cowboy burger is one of the best in the city. My girl had a shrimp peanut dish that was really tasty. Service was great and the drinks were really well made.  I will be back

I had the greek burger. ground lamb, cucumber tzatziki salad, with crumbled feta and more deliciousness than I could ever imagine. service was great, however another waiter thought he had our table so we were a little confused. down the star because there were a lot of kids here. not the restaurant's fault, but  i would be back definitely. i need that burger.

What a great spot to have in Roscoe village.  The food is GREAT and the staff so friendly.  The only bummer is sometimes you have to wait a bit as it is very popular on the weekends.  Very family friendly.  We have been many times and will go back.
Was I even here last night??? My Check-Ins say so!

I had a great brunch at John's place. I tried and enjoyed my girlfriend's salmon scramble. Very tasty. I had the eggs benedict and it was fantastic. Complimenting that was the home fries, which are a great combination of salty and spiced. Just a really simple and tasty brunch place. Haven't come here for drinks so this is basically a brunch review. Fair warning though is this is roscoe village, which is basically like boot camp for suburban families so expect very young kids seated around you so if you can't handle that sort of thing this may not be for you. But the food and service is good and worth it. I will be back.

Pretty good food (I had the croque madame which was a bit too cheesy) and the wait staff did a great job of managing our large group.  We had a large party and sat in the back, so yes, they can accommodate more than four people.   It's probably a nice place to sit outside when the temperature is right.

Wow, it's been 2 years since my review, & I've been back to John's numerous times. I guess I like it a little bit more than I thought!! Had a cowboy burger the other day; omg so good it prompted me to review my review! And prompted my husband to drag me back the other day just after I ate at hom so he could have company while he got a burger. The food has definitely gotten better and is more consistent. The servers are fast without a tinge of attitude.  Case in point:Katie (server) was super cool the other day when just my husband was eating & we had our dogs with us. I could imagine how you could be bummed having only 1 person at your table. If she was she didn't show it; plus brought ice water for the pups without us asking=bonus points. Good job John's, Oh in case anyone is wondering, I still wear those track suit pants!

I've tried this place a handful of times only to be dissapointed again and again. Which really sucks because I live down the street. The service is fine its the food that blows.  The burgers are good but thats about it. Literally five different meals I've had here were inedible and Im really not a picky person. Its also always packed with kids which is great for all the families in Roscoe Village but personally no thank you.  So go for the burgers or skip this place.

I recently went for breakfast/brunch here with my sister and it was really good. We had never heard of it and just walked around and decided to go in, but I'm glad we did. I had the challah french toast and it was delicious. I loved them! My sister had the Mexican Hash and it was so good! The poblano made the spice just perfect and the chihuahua cheese was great. I would definitely go back!

I really wanted to like this place...But I just couldn't!  We've walked past it a million times and finally went in a few weeks ago.  It  was a Saturday Morning and wasn't too crowded.  Most people were pushing to be outside but I like me some AC so we were seated right away inside.  And then we sat... and sat... and sat.  Just as we contemplated leaving our waitress arrived...  Two coffees and a Bloody Mary please (I had a rough night the night before!).  Then we sat... and sat... and sat...  "What is she, out picking the beans?  Where's my damn cof... Oh, thanks for the coffee!" So We finally get our food.  I ordered the Mexican Hash with two eggs over easy and a side of Bacon.  It was tasty... it was good!  The chicken was cut the same size as the potatoes so it was a surprise to your mouth which one you got.  And the poblano peppers (one of my favorite things to cook with) gave it a nice spiciness.  I loved the fact that they put the cheese on on the grill.  Where were little grilled bits of cheese mixed in the all the gooeyness... however... Was was it like 5 bites and then gone!  I wanted more.  MORE!  That portion size was so tiny.   My companion got the Chilequiles with chorizo added to it.  It was a good sized portion... but it wasn't good!  There was no spice to the chorizo.  It was just sorta blah!  I mean...  blah!!  The side of bacon, ok... I mean, it is bacon.  The Bloody Mary... watery with a kick in the end.  It had no flavor at all.  I didn't even drink it.   So, done eating.  Plates cleared by the attentive friendly bus men... and we sat... and sat... and sat...  No waitress.  Nothing.  Finally one of the nice bus guys went to get her for us.  Bad service and food that was not flavorful?  I think I'll pass on John's Place next time.

Great local neighborhood spot -- easy, reasonable, and good food.  And, the most amazing bread ever.  We probably went through 3 baskets of bread before dinner -- absolutely delicious.   We got a chocolate banana bread pudding for dessert -- holy amazing. Easily my favorite local dinner spot.

Really like this place. Very kid-friendly which is important in Roscoe Village. Good food, nice service. Menu is a bit small, beer/wine somewhat limited but there are very good selections all around. Great place to go to for any meal, knowing that your kids aren't going to bother the other folks because they probably have kids too. If you don't have kids, I'm not sure why you would go here, unless it's aver 8 or so! Brunch is a great thing, bottomless Mimosas but you have to ask sometimes, I'm not sure if they are on the menu anymore. Nice outdoor seating.

I've been going to John's Place for years. First in Lincoln Park, now in Roscoe Village. It's predictable, quick, reasonable and good food. We go primarily for breakfast and take our toddlers. It's great for kids. If you are looking for a quiet breakfast, probably not the place. Everyone is nice and they are willing to accommodate substitutions or changes. I'd recommend checking it out. If you can get there by 10 AM there is usually now wait even though it's a small place.

tuff crowd...the food is pretty good, i mean my girlfriend with her vegetarianism is a bitch to satisfy and she swears by their tofu sandwich.   I haven't exactly been like "God damn" but that never happens, most places have the same take on most other places menus...John's place isn't the exception, it isn't blazing culinary trails but it's worth a date night visit, especially if you have a vegetarian to feed.

John's Place is a great place to bring the family. They have healthy food that is tasty and great specials every night. Love going to brunch on the weekends and sitting on the patio. Everyone who works there is super nice and always have great service.

Comfortable, familiar looks are about the only thing this mediocre place has got going for it. I initially was going to write about how it's fine but boring and derivative, a fine place to just eat and start a day and pay a decent price, but then I remembered that the food was actually not good. Burger was dry, the brioche bun was the best part, french fries were flavorless. Sweet potato fries were good but not $5 good. Croque madame was overladen and one-note, which is something I generally expect for the sandwich, but the John's chopped salad actually kind of blew. It was like a mush. However, the place was pretty full, it's been around for almost 20 years, and it was highly recommended to me, so maybe they're just cruising, not feeling any pressure to change.  Whatever. Let people talk up the place, but the food is not good. Maybe I'd eat there again, because it is that comfortable, but I'd just get hummus and hope they didn't make it.

The good: good breakfast food.  They are great about customizing omelets. The bad: tons of small kids and pretty noisy.  Also, they should upgrade their seating in the booths.  Lots of tears on fabric and kind of beat down feeling. Overall, love the place for a good breakfast.  Decently healthy, not too greasy.

Definitely the best burgers on Roscoe. I've only ordered out a few times but the food has been consistently good. I found out about this place during burger fest, which they rightfully won. It's a little more then I like to spend on a burger, but after I'm done eating it, there are no regrets.
Love both locations.  It is just a solid go to place for brunch, lunch or dinner.  They have specials and always turn out good stuff.  Love the chiliaquiles.

I've dined at John's other location (Webster & Racine) several times, but just tried out the Roscoe location over the weekend.   The Good:  + drink specials.  $4 Svedka drinks - yes please, keep 'em comin'.  $3.50 beer specials - nice price.  They always seem to have good drink specials. + attentive, friendly service.  + decent/average prices.   $5 big bowl of their 'soup of the day' was a comforting chicken vegetable soup that took me back to my youngin' days when Mom would make huge pots of soup like this.   The Meh:  I've experienced a sense of 'blah' when ordering food at John's in the past.  I've yet to get a dish that really impressed me (other than the soup mentioned above...)  Case in point: goat cheese quesadilla - sounded awesome, looked kind of sad, tasted okay-ish.  (plain little tortilla folded over on a small plate topped with stale scallions - no sides, no garnish, nuthin'.  There was a satisfactory amount of goat cheese, mushrooms and spinach inside...) I'd go back to John's to try other menu items - particularly their breakfast.   I've seen a good number of other reviewers mention/complain about lots of kids in these restaurants.  Yes, there were kids there even during our Friday night meal.  The place has a 'family restaurant' vibe that must be appealing, and both locations have a lot of younger families living nearby.  I'm okay with that, as long as parents respect other diners and take responsibility for their children.

First time I heard about this restaurant was at burger fest. I didn't get to eat their winning burger but I eat their Angus. I became fan of it instantly. So I decided to have dinner there on Friday with a couple of friends. All of us loved the nachos as appetizer. I again went with the Angus burger which I believe was much better at the restaurant then at the festival. The only thing that I had a problem was the brunch menu. I returned back on Sunday with two other friends telling them how good it was. But to our disappointment the brunch menu did not have much on the menu.

The only positive thing I have to say about this place is that they have some pretty good drink specials. I went here in the summer with a few family members who never venture into the city nor its neighborhoods. They are not foodies by any means but I did expect some kind of taste to my food. I ordered the fish tacos and I felt like I was eating solidified air. The vegetables were not fresh, the fish was not even salted and my fries were soggy. My meal was absolutely tasteless but I did eat most of it because the waitress completely ignored our table so by the time our food arrived, we had been there for 45 minutes. It took over a half hour to get our checks and we debated about just throwing down some cash and leaving. I wasn't expecting a lot but I did expect to be treated like a normal paying customer.

My friends and I went to John's Place for our friend's dinner last Friday and, although the wait staff was nice, the food was mediocre for the prices and they had ridiculous charges. I had the turkey meatloaf and I could not even finish it because it was so mushy and tasteless. I think they put too many breadcrumbs in it or they just over-mixed it to the point of mushiness. A few of us got the southwest chicken salad and for the price it was not all that special. The lettuce they used was plain iceberg and aside from the dressing, the only thing that made it southwestern was the tortilla strips.  My friend got the shrimp pasta and she said it was really good. Also, the sweet potato fries they serve are delicious!  The other thing I found ridiculous about this place is that they charge $2 per person for a "cake cutting" charge. We have been bringing our own cakes to many different restaurant for years and this is the first place that has ever charged us for cutting the cake. On top of charging us for the cake cutting, the waitress didn't even cut it for us. I guess John's place was charging us $2 a person to use the plates, extra forks, and one big knife to cut it. I found it to be an extremely frivolous charge.  Suffice it to say, none of us will ever be going back to this place to eat again. There are better places to eat for the prices that this place charged.

The nachos with house made chicken chorizo are addictive. They will make you want them over and over and over again. The other food is good too, but nothing to sing about. The grilled chicken appetizer was alright but the yogurt sauce it came with was honestly bizarre. My husband adores the chili--the full meat one--and it's quite tasty with melty gooey cheese and some sour cream. Not diet food but will make you feel warm and fuzzy. I've had their salads and several breakfast items and they've all be consistently good. For sure, it's worth a try!

What's not to like about this place? Casual vibe with classy decor, decent bar, great service and a fantastic menu. These are just some of the things I love about this place. It is accommodating to kids and families but is also fine for a couple of single folks to grab a quick bite. Breakfast? The challah french toast is divine. It is fluffy and light and stands up to the syrup. Lunch or dinner? Hard to pick a favorite. The burgers are great. The salads rock. They don't try to do it all but they have a diverse menu that has some nice classics with a few twists. If you see it on the special board, try the mahi.  In short, this place is ALWAYS a solid choice.
Nothing too special about john's. Just a solid burger joint.

I have come here twice for weekday lunch and to sit outside whilst eating.  It is easy to park around there, especially during the weekday.  My guest ordered the Tuna melt with fries and I got the Cobb salad.  The waitress was freindly and very attentive to my empty glass of lemonade.  Good lemonade.  The bus-boy brought out the food, and assumed the salad was for the lady, what a macho man like myself can't order a salad?  Give the lady the sandwich and the check, HA!  Food was good, check was reasonable.

$2 Tacos and $4 Margaritas!!  John's Place is a great little place located in cute little Roscoe Village.  My friends and I frequent this place and usually have a great time.  Just beware this place is VERY kid and baby friendly.  So, you may have to gulp down your margarita's to the tune of screaming babies and a toddler's watchful eye.

Ugh! It is hard to even start to describe how awful my experience at Johns place was. First, the menus give you a bad impression because they reprimand your children for being children. I understand that there are negligent parents/ nannies who need to learn to control their children, but I think it is a bit much to have to print it and then have typos. Perhaps children wouldn't run around if they were offered a childseat? The Dino bite meal was like 5 dollars for 3 pieces and the worlds tiniest side. My sister ordered her hamburger  medium and was given a well-chared burger with an untoasted bun, three little tiny pieces of lettuce, and a miniature slice of tomato. I liked my black burger with the guac but it was a little undercooked. The iced teas were over priced and the waiter failed to acknowledge my empty glass so I was left parched. I think the straw that broke the camels back was when i went to eat my sweet potato fries and they tasted raw. I don't think I will ever go back here and especially not with children.

I have been to this place for breakfast twice so far, and both times it has been very good! I had the classic which was pretty much eggs Benedict,  it was great. The eggs were extremely white (which was funny to me) I thought it was sour cream at first. My boyfriend got a Mexican breakfast dish which he thought was going to be more of a breakfast burrito, stating that it was served with tortillas, but this meant there were tortilla chips mixed in. Overall it was good. Small portions, but enough for me to be full.  It is a little pricey, but I am sure that is due to the fact that everything seems to be organic or fresh from the market.  I will definitely try this place for lunch and maybe dinner!

I came here recently on a warm day with my son, in a stroller, and my friend and her son, also in a stroller.  We sat on the patio for lunch and very much enjoyed our food.  I had the apple, spinach, and goat cheese salad with salmon, and it was delicious.  It had a family-friendly atmosphere and service was good.  I would return for sure.

Best vegetarian Chili around and love the fish tacos... Great service, and atmosphere is family friendly, cool hangout Or quiet dining depending on the day. I have to say most of my experience is at brunch or lunch, but I have to assume the quality carries over to dinner hour. Great place in the hood to get a good meal and reasonably priced to boot...

While I still think 3 stars is fair for John's Place for dinner, I think they have a very lovely brunch, hence the 4 stars. I came here after a nice 3-mile jog on the lake front path, as we wanted to try some place new, so John's Place it was! They have a wide selection, that include your standard omelette, scrambled eggs, pancakes, etc. They also have some nice Mexican themed choices, such as Chiliquiles and Mexican Hash. I ordered a bunch of sides, because they didn't have exactly what I wanted, but I was pleasantly satisfied! The chocolate chip pancake was, in a word, awesome. For some reason, I've had a craving lately for chocolate chip pancakes, and any place that has 'em is a winner for me. Also ordered the scrambled eggs, bacon, and multigrain toast. All yummy! Lastly, the coffee here is super delicious and STRONG. It's intelligentsia coffee and so so good. We were all really satisfied with our brunch, and I can't wait to come back!

John's Place is a great neighborhood spot for a meal.  It is not too expensive and the food is delicious - I highly recommend the fish tacos and the meatloaf.  Yes, the BBQ meatloaf is excellent when you are in the mood for some comfort food. If you want to avoid the neighborhood kids - go a little bit later in the evening 7:30 or 8:00.  The restaurant is intimate and when the weather is good, there is outdoor seating which isn't too bad since Roscoe is not a high traffic area and there are not any buses. The brunch on the weekend is very good as well.  There are plenty of choices on the menu from eggs to pancakes and everything in between.  The price is also reasonable compared to other breakfast/brunch places in the city.  We feel like we get our money's worth with the brunch items on the menu - which is great since they are delicious!  The pancakes and eggs are filling and tasty.  Try a smoothie to go with your breakfast - they are delicious!
On the outside it's very unassuming but go in, it's cool. I'd go back. However, not great for a date or even groups really. Ideal for a casual meal with a pal.
Casual great local place, family friendly, easy menu.

Had a fantastic New Years Eve Dinner here.  We were a large group of 10.  The service was very attentive and the drinks and the food was superb.  I would have given them 5 stars, the only reason I did not was that the menu was a "one time deal"  The items that I enjoyed so much (scallop dish) is not offered as a regular menu item.
