John's Place is my go-to for those Saturday mornings where all I want is a glass of fresh squeezed O.J. and some good eggs. John's Scramble is my most frequently ordered item - and it never fails. Service is very friendly and I am always seated right away. This place does get packed when it is warm out as it is adjacent to Wrightwood - always a ton of little kids eating with their families here....of course, there's a huge mix of college kids and recent graduates as well.  I always come in here knowing that I'm going to come out feeling full and 100x better than when I walked through the doors.  Probably my most frequented spot in LP and never lets me down!

We stopped her for a quick lunch. We were seated and told the drink specials. ($4 glass of any wine) I ordered a burger, my boyfriend ordered the fish tacos. Food served up quick. Beer was served with a glass. There was a fruit fly that would not go away. I was not overly impressed with the food, price, or service. Everything was decent.

TACO Wednesdays!!! (SHOUT OUT TO Andrea and Tita!!!!)  Okay, now that I have that out of my system. . .I really enjoy Wednesdays at this location. Not only because I like the tacos @ $2, but because the $5 Margarettas are a good way to wash them down. The downside of Wednesdays at John's place, the screaming babies- UGH. Now, I'm all for family night, but it's hard to gossip with my girls with little Stevie crying all night. I realize that Roscoe Village is a family neighborhood, but can't you guys just go to John's place another day!? Here's the NITTY GRITTY aMbIaNcE= COMFORTABLE space, but small.  sTafF= I LIKE the waitress that we always get (she laughs at my jokes.) pRiCe= FANTASTIC. Check out their website, they have specials daily. fOOd= love those TACOS and the  MARGARETTAS (no lime, please) ***Side notes- it's much easier to find parking here then the Lincoln Park, but this place is smaller. They don't open until 5 p.m.

My husband and I moved into the neighborhood last June. John's Place is within walking distance to our house and has quickly become our go-to spot to take our guests. We've been there for lunch and dinner and haven't been disappointed. My favorites are: The Cowboy burger Apple, Spinach, and Goat Cheese salad Sweet potato fries Next on my "must try" list: Pulled BBQ Pork sandwich Challah french toast Blueberry crumble panackes John's Place has "safe" fare for the picky eaters, as well as some variety for those who aren't. The menu is quite meat-centric, which I don't mind at all, but some may not like. Their specials are deals. My friends and I come here on Thursdays for their $4 glasses of wine and a good meal. We're never rushed, and can sit and chat for a long time. They have excellent service. I called for reservations for 12 the day before and they had everything ready to go the moment we got there. The only reason I knocked off a star is that it can get noisy. In the summer, eat outside on the patio and the problem is eliminated.

When you've had a busy December, the one thing you don't want to do on a date night is scream at the top of your lungs in order to enjoy your mealdate. I knew Roscoe Village would be sleepy enough but offer plenty of variety for dinner. We went to John's Place on the Thursday night before NYE. We checked out the menu from the outside and struggled to find one dish we wanted to try -- because we wanted to try all of them. We walked through the winter drapes and were seated immediately. We were delighted to see a full bar, but opted for the $5/glass of ANY wine on the menu instead. The menu is small but, honestly, the right size. Had there been more we would still be choosing. We went straight to dinner after a cuppa soup (corn chowder, if I remember) which was amazing. My wife had the seafood bisque and I the turkey burger. Both were just right. The soup had the perfect blend of flavors but not to overwhelm the fish bits. We skipped dessert. So, in all, the bill was just $30 with tip and three glasses of wine. Not bad for a simple supper. We will definitely go back to check out more of the menu.

As a new residence to Roscoe Village John's Place was one of the first places we tried. I'm going to use the classic Yelp pros and cons list for this review.   The pros are as follows: 1. They serve above average American which is a great alternative to bar food when relatives who aren't adventurous eaters come into town.   2. Both times I went servers were attentive and friendly.  3. Food came out relatively quickly. The cons are as follows: 1. It's a little on the pricey side for standard American fare. 2. Always a ton of kids. This is not a good option if you're looking for a quiet meal.      In summary it's a decent neighborhood spot if you don't mind a lot of kids.

This is a really nice place overall.  The food was pretty good (didn't blow me away, but not bad), nice atmosphere, friendly staff, fairly priced, and prompt service.  It's a good location for dinner and I didn't feel anything was lacking.  I'll definitely be going back!

Just a great place for contemporary eating.  I went here with my bf and his dad a couple years ago.  It was a walk down Roscoe St. and into this place of simple dining.  Fresh and hot sirloin burgers and a nice appetizer was just right.  Our server was nice and the whole evening was complete here with a doggy bag.  A few beers between the dad and the bf.  And I was content with just a very plain place.

Trying to enjoy a meal out at John's Place is a natural form of birth control, because walking out of here you will be so fed up with the antics of children you'll question whether you ever want to see one again. Would you like to dine in an upscale day care? Because that's what eating at this place is like. Maybe this isn't fair since the establishment's owner can't really control their client's children, but then again I've eaten at other restaurants on Roscoe where the kids at least stay seated.  This is where tired mom's go to have a nice meal and maybe a glass of wine while they gab with their girlfriend while their children do laps around the tables and/or stand up in the booths to turn and stare at you unblinkingly while you try to choke down your delicious $2 Wednesday  tacos and get the hell out of there and get to your own peaceful livingroom. If the whole place wasn't ruined with child infestation, I would give this place 4 stars for good food, good wine, and an incredibly patient and sweet staff...but I'm including ambiance and the experience as a whole based on the 3 times I've been here.

Decent place, and convenient if you are in the neighborhood.  Nice servers who checked on us regularly.  We went for brunch.  Decent food, but not great.  I had the chilaquiles which had nice flavor, but were served lukewarm.  I won't be rushing back when there are so many options.

I found out about this place at Burger Fest this summer in Roscoe Village where I had the best Turkey Burger of my life. It was seasoned just right with red pepper infused feta loaded on top, and some kind of yummy sauce; even the bun was delicious.  A very well thought out burger!

This place is very convenientyl located down the street from my house.  I came on a Thursday for 1/2 price wine-glasses.  What a great deal!! I had one of the pinot noirs that was fantastic!  I had a bowl of the mushroom and potato soup.  It was nice and thick and very filling.  My mom and I also split the spinach and goat cheese quesadilla.  That, too, was very good.  My sister tried their burger, which I believe they're know for and she really enjoyed it.  They have other great specials on different nights of the week, which is always nice.  Our waitress knew that we were pressed for time since we were going to a play and was very good about getting our food out promptly and getting the check to us in plenty of time.

My first time here and overall had a pretty good experience.  We were greeted by a very nice waiter (I wish I had gotten his name) who encouraged us to take a booth to wait for our 3rd person in our group instead of at the bar because "we should grab a booth before the rush comes in."  Thoughtful and he didn't mind that we were maybe going to wait a little while to order food.  We were there on a Tuesday, 1/2 off all wine which was nice because their wine is a little pricey.  We ordered the philly cheese steak spring rolls, tasty but a little too much grease pooling up on all of our plates.  The menu seems to have something for everybody and I had a hard time deciding.  I chose the apple, goat cheese and spinach salad and asked for grilled chicken to be added.  I was surprised that it was only $2 extra for the chicken, I expected it to be more.  A very tasty salad, and exactly what I had anticipated.  My dining partners had the buffalo chicken sandwich and another chicken sandwich. All enjoyed their meals.  The service was very friendly and right on with everything.  When I asked the bus boy if I could have my salad to go, he enthusiastically said "absolutely" instead of the usual "ok."  Very friendly service on all fronts. Would go back when in the neighborhood and especially on a Tuesday if drinking wine.

Just OK.  A nice place, nice staff, and a nice menu.  But just nice, not great.  The portions are smallish (breakfast) and nothing that I probably couldn't do with a little effort.  I had the mexican hash with sourdough toast.  A little heavier on the cheese than I might have liked.  Not too much to eat for the price of the entree.  Also had a shortstack of the pumpkin pancakes.  Good... not great.  Not much pumpkin butter to slather on them.  Wife had the benedict with ham and gravy.  A little skimpy on the gravy really.  Asked for some more... another tiny little silver cup worth.  That didn't help.... For the same money, I like Chalkboard.

This place always has people there so i wanted to see why, well the service isnt anything special, im deducting a star for the service actually, but all i wanted was a gilled chicken sandwich with buffalo sauce on it, it came out with blue cheese on it, i dont like sending things back so i just picked it off, the chicken had so much spice on it i couldnt taste the buffalo sauce, i dont think i'll ever get that again, the fries were good my roommate tho got breakfast and ate it all, he loved it.  i know i'll back at this place to give something else a shot

I'm visiting a friend in the area and he took me here for brunch this morning.  I was really happy to see they had bellini's.  I have had better, but I still enjoyed it.  I also ordered the chocolate chip and banana pancakes.  They actually use real bananas.  And they are mixed into the batter, not sliced and put on top.  Really good.  My friend ordered the pumpkin pancakes.  We also ordered a side of potatoes and a fruit plate.  Aside from the bellini, everything was perfect.

First, this review is based only on the Pulled BBQ Chicken Sandwich. I understand from my friends that the apple and walnut salad is amazing and the tuna salad sandwich is delicious. The sandwich I had, however, was not good. It was too salty and too drenched in BBQ sauce. I suspect the sauce went a long way in making this sandwich terrible, so it should be an easy fix. The pickle and fries that came with the sandwich were delicious, however.

We patronize both of John's Places on a regular basis although we tend to spend more time in Roscoe Village since that location opened. We love John's Place because it offers fresh and delicious food (for adults and children) with reasonable prices and always friendly service. The only two suggestions we have for improvement are 1) add cherry pie to the menu (ideally the cherry pie from First Slice Cafe) and 2) offer delivery service. Otherwise, keep doin' what you're doin', John!

The Roscoe Village location isn't nearly as crowded as the Lincoln Park spot.  I like this restaurant a lot for brunch. They have delicious pumpkin pancakes and they're breakfast burrito is my favorite in the city.   They don't have a lot of options for dinner that I particularly like.  Overall, I really enjoy their atmosphere and service!
Excellent place for breakfast or brunch...have been here many times and have never had a bad meal.  It's a perfect place for the kids as all of the wait staff is very friendly.

I love this place. The sweet potato fries are my favorite, so be sure to get those. I also have to give a shout out to the service here -- I've always had great servers whether it's Sunday Brunch or Wednesday night.
Damn good burgers.  That's all you need to know.  But the service is good too, so put the two together and you've got a good meal at a fair price.

While I"ve enjoyed many plates of chilaquiles at their Lincoln Park location,* this was the first time I visited the Roscoe Village John's Place. We got there pretty late by brunch standards (around 2pm on a Saturday) so we were able to avoid the crowds and lots of small children that frequent John's Place. The service was speedy and it turns out their chilaquiles are just as tasty as they are in LP.  Everyone tells me this is the best spot for a family friendly brunch so I have a feeling we'll be there pretty often once our little one arrives. --------- Lincoln Park location:  yelp.com/biz/johns-place…

American fair with a twist.  Love it, good place for kids and dogs on the patio.  (not that kids should be kept on the patio ha).  I'm a little bit of a red meat junkie so I rarely order poultry but I usually get the chicken breast sandwich now.   "Pay for chicken, at a restaurant, that is crazy ."  -former Veronica "I love their chicken sandwiches." -reformed Veronica

The food here won't blow your mind but it is good.  Their Chili might blow your mind; I think that's their best dish.  Overall, this is an excellent place to go because it's comfortable with good seating indoors and out.  The service also has just the right touch of helpfulness without being annoying.  If you haven't been here yet definitely try it out.

Short review... Liked it but it was not memorable.  Our experience was marred by a career mom with her kids at a nearby table who spent most of her meal talking to someone, conducting a boring, pointless conversation. For some reason I always expect this place to be fancier than it is.

been in here a few times with the little kiddos i nanny-usually right around noon during the week.  it's actually a great place for kids-they seat us in the front and all the other diners in the back. the food is good-had the Roscoe Burger today-cheddar, bacon and grilled onions--delish!  kids love the mac n cheese and grilled cheese. service is always good...no complaints!

I gave this place a couple tries, and ...ugh.    The food is very good, but It's the atmosphere, service and bar that bring this place down. First of all, the atmosphere - bottom line: Unless you're a yuppie mom in a juicy couture track suit with a range rover sized stroller yapping on your phone while your kid whines and throws food...you will NOT enjoy the atmosphere.  Definitely don't go in there for happy hour, otherwise known as dinner time for the kids.  There were strollers every few feet, kids running around (I guess I'm supposed to think it's cute when someone else's kids comes up to my table while I'm eating), and the slowest service ever.   I suppose this place could be appealing to you if you have kids - they obviuosly cater to families - it just doesn't exactly make for a great happy hour or dinner spot for anyone else. Now the bar -  They claim to have a great wine selection, which is true, but no one behind the bar seems to know anything about it.  Including how to pour...these bartenders short pour EVERYTHING including the wine.  They either don't know what a proper glass of wine is, or assume the customers don't - either way I would rather go down the street to the Four Moon where they don't have as much of a selection, but  the bartenders know about the wine they are pouring. Overall, this place has a kind of soulless vibe, alot of kids running around and mediocre service.  I say pass.

I love John's Place. The food is always good to great. The drink specials are always a great value. The service is always very good and friendly.  All-in-all, it's the place that makes you feel at home in the neighborhood. Try the fish tacos.

This place is just too small to be quite as kid-friendly as it is.  The kids are loud, and the parents don't seem to understand that this is not a Chuckie Cheeses.  This is a small restaurant, maybe 15 tables, and the noise travels.  The food is generally good but not exceptional.  The service is generally exceptional and occasionally eh.  The price is usually about right.  The kids are more often than not WAY TOO LOUD.

Hmmm...John's has a great patio, and lunch during the week isn't too busy, but the food is really not great and the service, esp on the weekends is lacking. It's also apparently a great place for families because it's always swarming with kids.  So, if you're not concerned about getting a sumptuous meal and just want someplace basic, quick and nearby (Lincoln Park), John's is your place.

I go here mainly just  for the Baja fish tacos. I'm sure there's many places that offer just as good or better but its convenient for me to hit up this place. The talapia they use has a fresh taste and the flavor is great. Ask for chipotle mayo on side because sometimes they go overboard when its on the taco. Rest of menu is good but I'm basing that off the comments from the people that I'm with because I just get the tacos. Hey did I mention I just get tacos. OK enough with that. They only offer a small selection of bottle beers and a seasonal choice, no tap. On Tuesday they have half price wine bottles. Be warned though, if you go for an early dinner be prepared to sit amongst a bunch of kids wearing more expensive clothes than you. I'm guessing the Roscoe neighborhood is where fertile hipster go to reside.
Instead of driving to Roscoe village to eat eggs and stare at attractive people, save some money and cook eggs at home and just think about attractive people.

Been here a few times since moving into the neighborhood.  The first time wa sin October and my girlfriend and I sat at a nice table outside.  I ordered the Soup of the Day which was a seafood bisque of some sorts.  Let me just say, it was awesome.  Absolutely one of the best bowls of soup I've ever had.  The owner even came around to see how I like dit and commented that the next batch would be cooked with fishbones and that teh version I received was slightly sub par.  If this is sub par I can't wait to try the real deal.  I went back another time and tried the Veggie Chili.  It was hearty and hit the spot.  The servers are very attentive and the atmosphere is great.  They also have a mean Blondie for dessert.

I really like this restaurant.  It's kid friendly, but since it's so small they tend to be a bit obtrusive.  I have kids of my own and I would not bring them there during peak times.  Other than that, the food is great, the staff is cool, and the bartendar can make a great dirty martini.  It's a nice cool down spot on a Saturday when you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of Lincoln Park and Bucktown.
Great for a casual weekday dinner or weekend brunch.  Food is delicious and the service is always great.  In the warmer months they have a great outside space as well.

Today was the first time I had dined at John's place with my girlfriend.  We went for breakfast.  It wasn't super busy and we were sat right away.  The restaurant has a clean atmosphere and the booths were comfortable.  The service was great!  Very prompt and not too chatty.  I had the breakfast burrito, which was very good!!  My girlfriend got the pumpkin pancakes and were super tasty!  They were nice and spicy (not hot-spicy of course but pumpkin food spicy).  They came with a maple/pecan/syrup butter that was kickin!!  The portions here are smaller than most places so the prices may be a bit high.  The total for two breakfast plates and two coffees was around $24.  This being the only drawback of the experience.  Good food, atmosphere, and service... we will be sure to stop in again.
I love this restaurant! The service is always fantastic and the food is great (try the ck. bbq) The restaurant is cozy and a great family place.
Dog friendly in the summertime.  Great people watching with a sidewalk seating.  Good coffee and tasty omelets that often have a latin twist to them.
Service is always super nice. Brunch is good, dinner is pretty decent. Good drink specials, a chill, nice place for a small group of friends.
A solid step up from typical bar fare...nothing spectacular, but I will return for a repeat trip.

I had the most delicious brunch here last weekend. It was a cozy spot to dine in a great neighborhood.  My friend and I split the pumpkin pancakes--which were delish.  I got the decade french toast drenched in real maple butter.  My friend got the breakfast burrito with chorizo sausage and black beans.  The waiter was adorable and the service fast.  I will be back for a bloody Mary.

2.5:  If only .5 meant round down! I've been here twice and both times I've walked away fairly disappointed. The first was two years ago, but all I remember was that I told myself never again.  I broke that promise to myself about a month ago.  I had a better experience this second time, but nothing to come back for. I had a garlic chicken dish that was interesting, but lacked the strong flavor tones that make a dish pop. The lunch cost me 15 dollars for the dish and a drink which is definitely not a everyday meal cost I allow myself.  My friend and I agreed that this place is meant for the yuppie mothers that need their wine and "day time drinks" after dropping their kids off at day care or with their Latina nanny.  Like I said not my scene...

Great place for a quick bite they have a good selection of breakfast and lunch items, soup items change daily and they make a mean chili.  Keep in mind that you are in Roscoe Village and every time (day and evening) that I have visited there are always families with children in the restaurant.

Well I have been here only once and that was enough for me to not return. The food was ok for lunch but it was over run by unruly kids with parents/nannies who could careless.  The other day we were looking for a lunch spot to discuss an upcoming trip, as we walked by my boss said...how about this place. My response was for him to feel free but I refused to go in there.  I know people have to make $$$ but I don't have to spend my $$$ and deal with a clientele I could careless for. Oh well.

I have never been here for dinner, but I go fairly often for brunch.  I love their Chilaquiles, and the coffee is good.  Service has always been great.   Downsides - I love Bloody Marys, and so if I am in the mood for one, I will go elsewhere.  Their Bloody Marys are just okay.  I like mine spicier, more flavorful, and rimmed in celery salt.   -Sometimes the wait can be long.  Obviously the place is only so big, so I do expect to wait, and I'm okay with that.  I probably wouldn't come here at a peek eating hour in the winter because there really isn't anywhere indoors to wait.

Great dishes & good service.  Try the blondie bar for dessert.  I love the $4 glass of wine nights!  Burgers are good.  I agree with the Johnny A's posting about there being too many mom's with kids/strollers, etc.  A bit much.

I went for dinner and enjoyed myself - but wouldn't go out of my way to go again. Food was good, service was quick and prices were good enough. We were sat right away at an outdoor table, enjoyed a nice bottle of wine, and our food came very quickly. It was an enjoyable night but nothing to rave about.

If you want a quick bite, a burger, and some bland decorations, go to John's Place.     I did enjoy the $4 wine list on fridays as well as the courteous staff.     Vegetarian options are limited, but not terrible.  The worst thing about this place is the amount of moms who bring their kids.  It got a little out of hand.
I really love the brunch at this place.  It's basic and yummy - what more can you ask for?  You can make your own omlette and I've never been disappointed.  Bloody Mary's are super, too!

I'm going to update my 2 to a 3 because I had a pretty good turkey burger there for lunch. Staff is friendly, service was quick, but I'm still not that thrilled about their prices. With tip, it was about $11 for a turkey burger and fries. The turkey burger was good for a quick fix, but it's not the absolute best I've ever had, and I guess I have pretty high standards. The atmosphere is relaxed and it's an easy place to just pop in for a quick bite to eat. I was disappointed that their fish tacos are considered only a dinner item and are not available at lunch time. At least I know it's always around the corner if I don't want to drive anywhere.

john's is normally a good option for me... but last time I went turned me off big time and it will probably be awhile before I go back.  The service was perfect as usual, and $4 glasses of wine every Thursday, can't beat it!  But for a vegetarian-friendly restaurant, how can you run out of tofu!?  I was really disappointed.  I ordered the walnut and apple salad, which I have gotten many times before, and the walnuts tasted bad- i mean really mushy and rotten.  Yuck!  Then my goat cheese which I got on the side, looked like it had been leftovers from someone else's plate- it had food bits in it.  Yucky- the very sweet waitress said it was because of a shared spoon the cooks were using, but I still didn't want to see it.

John's Place is a cozy little nestled a few steps away from the epicenter of Roscoe Village activity.  Its a nice spot to stop for a beer and an appetizer while you enjoy a nice summer night.   LOCATION & ATMOSPHERE Being just a little space away from the rest of Roscoe Village makes this place nice and quiet.  You don't have to raise your voice to be heard.  Its calm, quiet, and comfortable. MENU A good selection of familiar "can't lose" items.  As the restaraunt's menu advertises, very "home style". VALUE & SERVICE Where John's Place barely misses 4 stars.  The guacamole is the most expensive in Lincoln Square or Roscoe village @ $8.  It came out within 2 minutes, which makes me wonder if its freshly made by hand or not.  With no more than an ice cream scoop full of guacamole, I also wondered why I was paying a full $8.  The service, while not poor, was quite hands-off. Despite that, John's Place is definitely worth a try if you're in the Roscoe Village area just enjoying a summer evening.

We go for brunch almost every week. The food is great, it's served VERY quickly, and the mimosas are delicious. Dinner is good too, lots of salads, really fresh and nicely cooked chicken, good homemade soups. My husband loves the burgers and pancakes, I love the Roscoe omelet and salads. Great outdoor seating too.

My fiance eats here all the time, since it's so close to his office.  He's been raving about it & has pretty much eaten the whole menu.  Today, since I had the day off, I met him for lunch there.  It's a cute place & I really enjoyed it.  It's great for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike.  I had the tofu sandwich & broccoli, and it was terrific.  My fiance is a big  fan of the salmon BLT & tuna melt that are sometimes on special, the turkey burger & chili from the every day menu, although he says everything's good so it's hard to pick a fave!

I was impressed at first in the two or three vegetarian options and liked the atmosphere of this place. However, when I got my order I was sorely disppointed. The stir fry veggies with tofu and rice - so sweet that my riesling tasted dry. yuk. more rice than veggies and soggy tofu. Sorry but I would not visti this place for food again give the other options in the city.

I went to John's Place for the first time for dinner yesterday and I loved it. Their menu is really varied and has interesting, out of the ordinary dishes that someone actually put thought into, and that really made me happy. It also made me happy when they sat us far away from the small children who were throwing hummus veggies through the air. Thanks for that. We had the shrimp tostadas as an appetizer and they were great. And that red stuff they give you with the bread? I don't know exactly what it is, but I could pretty much just eat it with a spoon. Although the bread was really good too so I did that instead. Plus I didn't have a spoon. For my entree I had the BBQ pulled chicken melt on brioche. It was completely messy and awesome. It came really hot, but I was so hungry and it was so good, I burned the roof of my mouth and I don't regret it. The chicken was a nice variation from pulled pork. Sweet potato fries were good too- not the absolute best I've ever had, but definitely good. I can't wait to go back there and try the mango glazed pork... or the turkey meatloaf... or the salmon! Extremely affordable too. Good stuff.

Hello Fish Tacos!!!!!!!   After hearing from friends how affordable & delish John's Place in Roscoe Village was I decided to give it a try for myself last week. In the spirit of summer we decided to start with a couple of cold beers and an order of chips & guacamole which were all fantastic.  I'm always a big fan of fish tacos when they're done right & these were amazing, the pico de gallo & chipotle mayo that accompanied them were sorta sweet, sorta spicy...perfect.  My friend decided on the turkey meatloaf since he's watching his weight but still loves comfort food, he said that the chipotle bbq sauce was a unique/tasty touch.  We wrapped up the evening with a couple of specialty cocktails & decided to skip dessert even though the chocolate toffee blondie was totally calling our names......next time!!

Absolutely love it here. Very kid friendly. We usually go Sunday for breakfast and the food is always great. Very standard fare, exceptional service. They have a nice outdoor area too to eat outside. Try the chilaquiles.

I had lunch there for the first time today.  I know most people don't give two shakes about vegetarians (which I am one). But this place does. They have plenty of options for meat-eaters. However, they have several options on their menu for us non meat-eaters. I had a delicious three bean soup and tofu, veggie bowl. It was yummy. And I am grateful that John's Place works so hard to please customers with varying food tastes. Another Bonus:  It is located on a lovely street in the Roscoe Village area. They also have outdoor seating -- a PLUS!!

I had the burger with carmelized onions and cheddar cheese, and my cousin had the regular angus burger, and they are excellent!  hand formed patties -- wow.  I will definitely go back...I used to go to the one in lincoln park, and I am glad I went again to the one on roscoe.  excellent.

This place is great.  Casual atmosphere, fantastic prices, good comfort food.  I've been here for dinner and breakfast and loved both. The food is good, nothing fancy or incredible, but very good.  I've had the chicken and the turkey meatloaf and loved both. Service is very good and friendly.  We had a reservation for a group of five for a Friday night and they sat us immediately at a very nice table. It can be a little noisy and there are usually a lot of kids, but it didn't bother me at all. If you are looking for a cheaper option that still offers a nice atmosphere and good food, this is the place to go.

a terrific addition to the roscoe neighborhood and a much less crowded scene than the webster location to boot. the food is always great and as long as you don't mind screaming children the atmosphere is pretty nice too.

I really like the ambiance and understated decor but my meal was mediocre. $3.50 for one chicken apple sausage. And my pb pancakes left more to be desired. They were ok but it would have been better that the pancakes themselves have pb flavor instead of just some pb chips on top of plain pancakes. I would give them a second chance and perhaps try one of the lunch or dinner menu options.

Well I thought the John's chicken salad was the best.......well I am going to have to vote for new favorite: DOUBLE CHOCOLATE BREAD PUDDING. Okay, I am NOT a big dessert person; I can probably count on one hand the times I have ordered dessert. But I was with other people who wanted to share desserts (let me blame them) and I was totally blown away. How do they make it so good? Are they going to hate me if I just go there to eat that?

Good food at reasonable prices. The sweet potato fries I could live without, but for the most part the food is pretty good. The service outside is always slow, I mean for a lunch it needs to be fast. After we finished eating and had our plates cleared the wait for our check was 10mins and on most days outside it is. I advise anyone that dislikes eating at a family friendly place NOT to go here! There is always a line of strollers down block in the "stroller parking" zone. Expect stay at home moms and nanny's at 90% of the tables. If you are a stay at home mom or nanny this place is perfect for kids and finding play dates.

Great little casual spot. Be forewarned, it's in Roscoe Village and is kids central. That's a huge draw for me but I'd come here anyway. Really great service and always some sort of drink special. Brunch is pretty solid. Tried dinner for first time tonight. Who would've thunk they would have such amazing fish tacos. Decent guac. My daughter loved her grilled cheese.

Everything here for brunch and lunch is pretty good. From pancakes and omelets to paninis and salads, I wouldn't say it's AMAZING, but definitely good. I am a huge fan because it's always easy to park, we're always seated right away, and the wait staff are wonderful. Definitely family friendly as well.

Went here once... won't be going back.  It wasn't bad... it just wasn't anything special.  When there are so many amazing restaurants to choose from in Roscoe Village - why bother with a place that's pricey but just so so?

Ate here yesterday for the first time and it was $17.75..NOT worth spending!  I had chicken breast, sauteed veggies and salad.  Our daughter had chicken nuggets and ice cream.(can't go wrong with that)  The salad came out first, and not even five mins later... here comes the entree...I told the waitress please take the salad off of my bill, because my entree would have been cold by the time I was finished eating it, she did!  My waitress was great but the food is Denny's worthy and I give it a "0" on the Ranch rating! its obviously packaged!
Yummy!  I love that they use fresh ingredients and that the menu isn't expected comfort food.

After conquering the Webster Ave location, the stroller brigade has unceremoniously turned this John's Place outpost into romper room. They have a stroller corral outside. The food is great. I love all 3 of the chopped salads.  The pancakes are yum. The egg dishes are delish. But the crying begins to get to me by the time the bill comes...

Went here for St. Patrick's day for the corned beef and cabbage but since they were out we got to try their other dishes.  For appetizer we had the philly cheesesteak burritos which were great.  I had the blackened salmon special and my bf had the carne asada.  Both were good.  For dessert we had the toffee crunch blondie which was excellent.  The place was very clean, had a great atmosphere (not too quiet or crowded), and wonderful service.  The entrees were a bit on the expensive side but we will definitely be back to try the hamburgers which sounded great!
I'm quite the picky eater and they are ultra accommodating! The cute waiter and the owner selected the perfect work-time lunch for me. Perfect addition to Roscoe Village!

Really like this addition to the Roscoe corridor.  I LOVE their Huevos Rancheros.  Everything we've had in our three visits has been delicious, and the service has been consisitently spot on.   There are lots of kiddies, but many more of the cute variety, with relatively attentive parents.  Nothing like the crazies at John's sister location in Lincoln Park.

Good quality food. Good deals. The waitress/bartender was a little over the top but not in the best way; perhaps just an off night. Half price bottle of wine on Tuesdays. Quality place, good food.  I had the turkey burger only with goat cheese instead of feta, roasted red peppers and balsamic glaze. I ate it open face and enjoyed it, although it was a tad dry so it didn't quench my craving. The broccoli was REALLY good. I had a few sweet potato fries too, good, but average.

I am so happy we have a great new breakfast/ lunch spot in Roscoe Village... The atmosphere is cozy and the service has been exceptional.  I have actually been there twice this week and been happy with both meals. The burger was excellent as the chopped salad was fresh!  Love it...

We stopped in at John's place last night after finding that the Turkish place across the street was completely packed. We were warmly greeted by a woman who is the bartender, hostess and one of two servers. She's busy but efficient. I like the atmosphere here. It's cozy and warm. But the menu is a bit odd. It's not completely comfort food and it's not really high brow gourmet. It's weird, not in a good way. There are things like burritos! on the menu. I mean, seriously, a burrito shouldn't not be on any menu except at a taqueria. I had the cajun chicken pasta. It was okay. Too many peas, bland sauce and just average overall. The house salad at the beginning of the meal was generously portioned. The apple tart at the end was divine. I think the food is overpriced for what's served. It's basically diner food. Improve the menu and I'll be back.

Still bringing me brunch-time sunshine. This time around I had the pumpkin "pie" pancakes...not too sweet. I wish I could have gotten a little more of the butter, but my waistline could probably do without. My boyfriend had the chilaquiles...delicious!  Service was prompt and courteous...nothing over the top or lacking. John's place is warm and inviting. And yeah, there are lots of families there with little kids. But good parents keep them under control!

I have only ever been here for breakfast, and its good.  Not great, but good.  It's a cute little place, with really good service, great atmosphere, and good food.  The breakfast food is nothing fancy - just simple, good food.  I really want to try another meal here since I live close, but haven't yet.  I will be back to check out lunch and dinner, and I'm leaving it with 3 stars now because I was satisfied.

I love this place, it's a great neighborhood spot. The atmosphere is warm and relaxed and  the staff is friendly and on the ball. I'm vegan but my family members are not and it is one of the few places where we can all dine happily together. The tofu dishes are great and my parents rave about the salads and the meat dishes.

Came here for brunch and was much happier with the selection. The prices were a bit high, but my goat cheese, leek, zuchini and other yummy stuff omlette was STUFFED with the good stuff. The pancakes were a little boring from what I saw (boyfriend's brother ordered them and they were "okay"), though the description on the menu was good.  I'll go here again for brunch when the lines at the other RV brunch spots get too long.

A very welcome addition to the Roscoe Village neighborhood!  I love going to John's b/c the food is great and there are some great options for my 2 year old as well.  Kids are extremely welcome here and John the owner is always around, he is very friendly and remembers us each time we come in.  Thanks for coming to my neighborhood, we will keep on coming back!

I had been meaning to try this place for a long time and recently made my way in. The atmosphere is nice and the service is prompt and friendly.. I actually had the pleasure of meeting John while  was in there. We talked sports and about the neighborhood. So far I have had the burger (good stuff) and the chilaquiles (loved salsa on my eggs). This is a very neighborhoody place and has a very friendly feel. Good job John!

my bf and I have been here two times and we will be back again! The only complaint i have is their pb&j pancakes. They werent good at all...dry, dull...plain ol' disappointing. I did however have their roscoe burger which was delicious. I walked away a very happy girl that evening! The scramble with sausage, peppers, onions and mushrooms was also delicious! The soup has been great both times as well. service was great the first time and not so great the second time. Which is odd because it was slow the second time we went. Being a server myself, I am very understanding, but this was ridiculous. The bus boys stood around while we needed coffees filled several times. I think the server was very new, so understandable.

John's is pretty pricey for what you get out of it. But it is in Roscoe Village, where nothing is cheap.  The Burger was quite good, and the service was prompt. Johns has a nice list of Beer and Wine's to try. But after Kuma's, I'm totally ruined for any other Burger joint.  I would walk through Hell in a Gasoline suit for a Kuma's burger.

I never even knew this place existed until last night! And I have ask myself, could it be due to the name of this joint? It certainly doesn't scream "I am a really good restaurant, eat here!"  I went with a large group of friends--this place is small, so you definitely want to make a reservation. Our table ordered a variety of different dishes: Chicken Parm, Chopped Cobb Salad, Teriyaki Salmon, Chicken Pot Pie... all seemed to be pleased with their meals. I especially enjoyed my salmon... and the mashed potatoes! Everything you've heard about the chipotle mashed potatoes is true! OH MY, it was like heaven in my mouth.  Overall, this place didn't WOW me like I've been wowed before, but it certainly has charm, some tasty dishes, and stiff cocktails!

The burger here was good, but at those prices I would rather get one from Kuma's.  The chipotle mashed potatoes were the bomb though!  Service was good, and the space is small, but cute.  I agree with the other reviews that say this place needs a catchier name, otherwise I would tend to forget about it.

I ate brunch here with two friends.  It is cute inside, but getting one of the three booths that actually give you some room is key.  Otherwise, you are at tables eating on top of strangers.   The omelettes were great.  Our server competent and friendly, but I have to go with 3 stars because the pancakes were not good.  The blueberries were frozen or canned or something.  They were shriveled and sour.  Ick .  It ruined every part of the pancake it touched.  Why serve them?  The strawberries/banana fruit plate was fresh - why not switch it to that.  Also, the pancakes themselves were average, meaning not fluffy.

Ok, so the chilaquiles were not, technically, the same as you get in Mexico. So different, in fact, that I almost told the waitress that there must have been a mistake.  Then I took a bite, and yes. They are *chilaquiles* of a sort. Kind of a gourmet version, but as it turns out, quite good. Overall I was happy with the place, loved my food and would go back again.  But not on the same day as the Halloween Parade. Because when it ends, all the parents are tired and want to have a drink, and all their kids are hopped up on sugar, and they all decide to go to John's Place.  The owner ( I assume, ro at least the manager) thanked us as we left, with a kind of "Sorry about all the kids" look on his face, so I will return.

The food was ok, as in just ok. There wasn't much atmosphere, It's the kind of place that  brings the neighborhood down restaurant-wise because it's just so blahh. It's not that it's awful, it's just that Roscoe has lots of better choices.  I would go to any other restaurant on Roscoe before going back here.

Eating breakfast on my frequent trips to chicago always make me long for earlier mornings and better options here in LA. Last weekend, my friends and I made a quick breakfast stop at John's since it's right in the neighborhood and seemed like a good new option. Service was efficient yet patient considering we were taking up a 4 topper on a busy Saturday morning, waiting a half hour for our 4th to join us. Everyone else seemed happy with their egg white omelet, scrambles, etc. But I was definitely in love with their banana french toast. Carmelized bananas on challah french toast?! Fahgedaboudit!!!!!

I met a couple of girlfriends and their kids at John's Place today for lunch, and it was the perfect destination to go with little ones.  Good kids menu, crayons and an activity placemat to keep the little ones occupied, plentiful high chairs, and plastic cups with lids and straws make it very kid-friendly, and it shows in the crowd.  The grown-up menu had a number of options, and we all enjoyed our meals (fish tacos, curried chicken salad sandwich, and hamburger).  The service was friendly, and they were happy to let us hang out and catch up.  It was relaxed, but not so much so that we had to freak out when one of the kids started to melt down a little.

I wanted to give this place 3.5 stars, but I've bumped it up to four because of the fantastic atmosphere. It will quickly become a favorite of the neighborhood. The reason for the 1/2 star deduction - the broccoli. It was just steamed and I really wanted something a bit more flavorful. (My wife, who unlike myself enjoys vegetables, thought they were fine) However, the rest of the experience was great. The Carne Asada was absolutely delicious - the steak was cooked perfectly and the chipotle mashed potatoes were amazing. Both made me cry because of taste and spice. We ordered the Cornmeal Calamari for an appetizer and they were really good. I'm not sure what cornmeal does to the flavor or texture compared to other fried calamari, but we (mostly I) finished the entire plate. My wife thought the vegetable pot stickers were OK and her talapia was good. To finish it, their apple tart dessert was fantastic. This is definitely a place we'd recommend and a place we'll be back to for a great meal in a friendly, comfortable atmosphere.

I went here with my girlfriend and ordered some type of chicken salad for $10.99.  I was expecting a GREAT salad for that price but to my surprise, the salad was a Dole salad you get at Jewel and pre-cooked cold dry chicken.  You may ask...how do I know it was Dole...well the lettuce was poor, there was shredded cabbage and carrotts in eat...definitely a Dole salad. I would NOT recommend this place!!!!

Things have picked up considerably... I haven't been back yet, but my weekend walks with Morgan down Roscoe show the bugaboo set and then some have found their way to John's Place!! It's been bustling and the buzz appears to be good... I also hear the service has tightened up after opening-week jitters.  Get over there, grab some grub and save a seat for me!

John's Place continues to get better with every visit. I was excited to see John's place open down the street frrm my place. Although it seemed to take a while to open, it has proven it is worth the wait!  The food is great and comforting. The staff is always very friendly each of my three visits so far. The prices are reasonable. Great add to the village!

So I've heard of this "John's Place" in Lincoln Park, although the name makes "Sarah Plain and Tall" look like Cher.  Anyway, when I saw it was opening a new location right down the street from me, I figured we'd give it a shot. The staff was super friendly; although it wasn't super crowded, I got the feeling they would be just as friendly under pressure.  The drink selection was fine, just the right amount of beers and wines.  I heard the menu was "eclectic" and, while the appetizers were (we had some scrumptious baked goat cheese), the entree menu was pretty typical and a little small, with standards like tilapia and chicken parmesan, all reasonably priced.  My fiancee got the soup and I went with the chicken parmesan.  The food took a while (the bread while we waited, however, was delicious, if expectedly so) and I got just a little worried when a table seated after us got served first. Our waitress came over to us a couple minutes later to let us know our ticket was lost and she apologized kindly for the delay.  Honestly, at that point, I didn't feel like it was long at all, especially as it was still only about a tenth of the wait for food at, say, Turquoise Cafe.  Our food came out just a few minutes later and I think I understood the "eclectic".  It wasn't that chicken parmesan is eclectic, but the way they prepared and presented it was.  More like "food done eclectically".  Either way, it was perfectly crusted and the noodles were great, albeit a tad too much tomato, but that could just be me, tomatoes being my Kryptonite. Anyway, when the final bill came, my eyes literally bugged out of my face ala Tom and Jerry, but in a good way, because it was way cheaper than I thought it would be.  That quality of food and service would be twice as much anywhere else in the city.  Of course, we didn't get drinks, so that might have helped.  But, still, for fine food, a well-priced menu, and a wonderful staff, give John's Place a whirl. My only concern is that, like the name, it may come across as forgettable.  But, even if it's not unique, it's definitely one of the best "typical" restaurants out there.
